passages.name: EVERY TIME YOU THINK FOR A SECOND THAT THE HATCHET IS GOING TO HIT HER SKULL
passages.text:
But it doesn't.

[[YOU HAVE FAR MORE WOOD THAN WILL FIT IN THREE BASKETS]]

links.text: YOU HAVE FAR MORE WOOD THAN WILL FIT IN THREE BASKETS

destination.name: YOU HAVE FAR MORE WOOD THAN WILL FIT IN THREE BASKETS

passages.name: YOU HAVE FAR MORE WOOD THAN WILL FIT IN THREE BASKETS
passages.text:
So you stack up one load, as much as you can carry, and resign yourself to a long morning of hauling logs up the hillside.

[[YOU SET OFF, TRUDGING IN TIME TO THE SONG]]

links.text: YOU SET OFF, TRUDGING IN TIME TO THE SONG

destination.name: YOU SET OFF, TRUDGING IN TIME TO THE SONG

passages.name: YOU CAN HEAR THE SPIT MOVING IN HIS MOUTH
passages.text: While you stand there trying to warm your fingers in your armpits, he stops chewing for a moment to fire a glob of black spit at the ground by his feet. [[THERE'S ALREADY A POOL OF IT CONGEALING IN THE DIRT|dirtwood]]

links.text: THERE'S ALREADY A POOL OF IT CONGEALING IN THE DIRT

passages.name: dirtwood
passages.text:
When the first load of logs have been stacked, Humphrey locks the woodshed and sets off back towards the copse, swinging his empty basket.

[[YOU AND GRACE FOLLOW CLOSE BEHIND|followwood]]

links.text: YOU AND GRACE FOLLOW CLOSE BEHIND

passages.name: followwood
passages.text:
You make another trip, and then another, until your hands and feet and face have all gone quite numb. On each return you wait outside the woodshed, picking splinters from your fingers, while the Bogeyman watches you and chews.

[[THE SUN IS HIGH OVERHEAD WHEN IT HAPPENS|sunwood]]

links.text: THE SUN IS HIGH OVERHEAD WHEN IT HAPPENS

passages.name: sunwood
passages.text:
You're about halfway back to the hovel, and you hear behind you the unmistakable noise of wood – and flesh – on stone.

[[YOU AND HUMPHREY BOTH TURN|turnwood]]

passages.name: THE HANDLE OF THE BASKET HAS SNAPPED OFF
passages.text:
Between you, you manage to rouse her and keep going without much time lost. She wipes the blood on her nightdress.

[[WHEN YOU GET BACK TO THE HOVEL THIS TIME, THE BOGEYMAN'S GAZE BURNS YOU|burnwood]]

links.text: WHEN YOU GET BACK TO THE HOVEL THIS TIME, THE BOGEYMAN'S GAZE BURNS YOU

passages.name: burnwood
passages.text:
Once the remaining wood has been stacked, he beckons the three of you over. You stand in a line, Grace's hands folded politely behind her back, Humphrey's stuffed defiantly in his pockets.

[[THE PUDDLE OF SPIT IS HUGE NOW, AND THE SMELL STINGS YOUR EYES]]

links.text: THE PUDDLE OF SPIT IS HUGE NOW, AND THE SMELL STINGS YOUR EYES

destination.name: THE PUDDLE OF SPIT IS HUGE NOW, AND THE SMELL STINGS YOUR EYES

passages.name: THE TIME PASSES IN SILENCE
passages.text:
When at last <<if $waterduty>>the tank is full<<else>>the last of the firewood has been stacked<<endif>>, you stop for lunch.<<if $nofood>> Despite your enforced fast, you have to sit at the table and watch the other children eat, your empty stomach growling.<<endif>>

[[THERE'S NOTHING ON THE MENU BUT STALE BREAD AGAIN]]

links.text: THERE'S NOTHING ON THE MENU BUT STALE BREAD AGAIN

destination.name: THERE'S NOTHING ON THE MENU BUT STALE BREAD AGAIN

passages.name: THERE'S NOTHING ON THE MENU BUT STALE BREAD AGAIN
passages.text:
In the afternoon, all five of you report for pit duty.

[[ARMED WITH SHORT-HANDLED SPADES]]

passages.name: ARMED WITH SHORT-HANDLED SPADES
passages.text:
The Bogeyman resumes his position in the doorway while you help each other down into the pit. It's already about five feet deep, with enough room for three of you to dig, while the others wait at the top to collect the debris of grit and soil one bucket at a time.

[[TABITHA EXPLAINS]]

passages.name: TABITHA EXPLAINS
passages.text:
"It's for the outhouse," she says. "When the pit underneath gets full, we cover it over and start a new one."

[[GROSS]]

passages.name: GROSS
passages.text:
The dirt is dry and raises clouds of dust which make you cough. Almost every time you thrust your spade into the ground, it strikes a lump of rock which takes minutes to prize free and pass up to the surface.

[[YOUR FINGERNAILS ARE CLOTTED WITH GRIME]]

links.text: YOUR FINGERNAILS ARE CLOTTED WITH GRIME

destination.name: YOUR FINGERNAILS ARE CLOTTED WITH GRIME

passages.name: YOUR FINGERNAILS ARE CLOTTED WITH GRIME
passages.text:
After a few hours of digging, you start to unearth bugs. Dark red worms of six inches or more, they squirm from the newly broken earth over your feet and coil around your legs. Splitting them with your spades only does so much to slow them down.

[[YOU SPEND AS MUCH TIME KILLING WORMS AS YOU SPEND DIGGING]]

links.text: YOU SPEND AS MUCH TIME KILLING WORMS AS YOU SPEND DIGGING

destination.name: YOU SPEND AS MUCH TIME KILLING WORMS AS YOU SPEND DIGGING

passages.name: YOU SPEND AS MUCH TIME KILLING WORMS AS YOU SPEND DIGGING
passages.text:
Pit duty lasts into the evening, until you're digging in the dark, swinging your spade like a zombie, dead to the ache in your back and arms and legs.

<<if $nofood>>[[YOU'RE FAINT FROM HUNGER BY THE TIME THE BOGEYMAN SUMMONS YOU BACK INDOORS|dinner]]<<else>>[[YOU'RE FAINT FROM THIRST BY THE TIME THE BOGEYMAN SUMMONS YOU BACK INDOORS|dinner]]<<endif>>

links.text: YOU'RE FAINT FROM HUNGER BY THE TIME THE BOGEYMAN SUMMONS YOU BACK INDOORS
YOU'RE FAINT FROM THIRST BY THE TIME THE BOGEYMAN SUMMONS YOU BACK INDOORS

passages.name: dinner
passages.text:
Everyone sits together for a simple dinner. <<if $nofood>>You envy the others their raw vegetables in vile-smelling sauce. Everybody acts like they don't hear your stomach growling.<<else>>This time, when you pronounce your gratitude, you really mean it. Raw vegetables in vile-smelling sauce are a blessing after the afternoon's work.<<endif>>

[[CHEWING ALL DAY HASN'T DENTED THE BOGEYMAN'S APPETITE|CHEWING ALL DAY HASN'T DENTED THE BOGEYMAN'S APPETITE1]]

links.text: CHEWING ALL DAY HASN'T DENTED THE BOGEYMAN'S APPETITE

destination.name: CHEWING ALL DAY HASN'T DENTED THE BOGEYMAN'S APPETITE1

passages.name: THE FIVE OF YOU RISE
passages.text:
When the table is clean and the washing up done, he has you all gather around the table again.

[[HE UNCORKS A BOTTLE OF SOMETHING THAT'S NEARLY WHITE]]

links.text: HE UNCORKS A BOTTLE OF SOMETHING THAT'S NEARLY WHITE

destination.name: HE UNCORKS A BOTTLE OF SOMETHING THAT'S NEARLY WHITE

passages.name: HE UNCORKS A BOTTLE OF SOMETHING THAT'S NEARLY WHITE
passages.text:
{{{Time for bed.}}}

[[HE POURS OUT FIVE GLASSES]]

passages.name: HE POURS OUT FIVE GLASSES
passages.text:
The stuff is thick and clinging, almost jelly. It's marbled with blue and green. Looking around the table, you see that your serving is the smallest.

[[TABITHA'S IS BY FAR THE LARGEST]]

links.text: TABITHA'S IS BY FAR THE LARGEST

destination.name: TABITHA'S IS BY FAR THE LARGEST

passages.name: TABITHA'S IS BY FAR THE LARGEST
passages.text:
{{{Drink your milk, children,}}} the Bogeyman urges, and the others – with varying amounts of grimace – do as they're told. Your glass, when you lift it, is cold to the touch.
[[TAKE A SIP]] [[KNOCK IT BACK]]

passages.name: TAKE A SIP
passages.text:
The taste is not as bad as the feel of it inside your mouth. It sticks to your teeth and throat until you have to drink the rest just to get it down.

[[THE EMPTY GLASS SLIDES FROM YOUR FINGERS AND ROLLS ACROSS THE TABLE]]

links.text: THE EMPTY GLASS SLIDES FROM YOUR FINGERS AND ROLLS ACROSS THE TABLE

destination.name: THE EMPTY GLASS SLIDES FROM YOUR FINGERS AND ROLLS ACROSS THE TABLE

passages.name: KNOCK IT BACK
passages.text:
The taste is not as bad as the feel of it in your mouth. Try as you might to swallow it quickly, it insists on //oozing,// sticking to your teeth and throat until you manage to force the last of it down.

[[THE EMPTY GLASS SLIDES FROM YOUR FINGERS AND ROLLS ACROSS THE TABLE]]

links.text: THE EMPTY GLASS SLIDES FROM YOUR FINGERS AND ROLLS ACROSS THE TABLE

destination.name: THE EMPTY GLASS SLIDES FROM YOUR FINGERS AND ROLLS ACROSS THE TABLE

passages.name: THE EMPTY GLASS SLIDES FROM YOUR FINGERS AND ROLLS ACROSS THE TABLE
passages.text:
The kitchen starts swimming. You see the other children as blurred shapes making their way sluggishly up the stairs.

[[YOUR BODY IS LIMP IN ITS SEAT]]

links.text: YOUR BODY IS LIMP IN ITS SEAT

destination.name: YOUR BODY IS LIMP IN ITS SEAT

passages.name: YOUR BODY IS LIMP IN ITS SEAT
passages.text:
The Bogeyman says something to you, right in your ear. You close your eyes to stop the swimming.

[[YOU FEEL YOURSELF BEING LIFTED]]

passages.name: YOU FEEL YOURSELF BEING LIFTED
passages.text:
Arms as warm and soft as marble are carrying you to bed. All the pain <<if $nofood>>and hunger <<endif>> in your body is gone, everything dissolved in the dark.

[[THROUGH THE FOG YOU CAN HEAR SINGING]]

links.text: THROUGH THE FOG YOU CAN HEAR SINGING

destination.name: THROUGH THE FOG YOU CAN HEAR SINGING

passages.name: THROUGH THE FOG YOU CAN HEAR SINGING
passages.text:
<<timed 0.1s t8n>>{{{The fourth crow wasn't there at all,}}}<</timed>>
<<timed 1s t8n>>{{{Wasn't there at all...}}}<</timed>>

<<timed 4s t8n>><<click "SLEEP">><<goto "SLEEP">><</click>><</timed>>

passages.name: HE SITS BACK AND SIGHS
passages.text:
{{{I was let down today, by this one – }}}he stabs a finger at Grace, who winces{{{ – and this one, who tried to protect her by lying.}}}

<<if $takeblame>>[[HE GRIPS YOU BY THE CHIN|chin]]<<else>>[[HE GRIPS HUMPHREY BY THE CHIN|chin]]<<endif>>

links.text: HE GRIPS YOU BY THE CHIN
HE GRIPS HUMPHREY BY THE CHIN

passages.name: chin
passages.text:
{{{Everyone take a moment to admire how far such behaviour will get you.}}}

<<if $takeblame>>[[HE TILTS YOUR BRUISED FACE AROUND FOR THE WHOLE TABLE TO SEE|bruise]]<<else>>[[HE TILTS HUMPHREY'S BRUISED FACE AROUND FOR THE WHOLE TABLE TO SEE|bruise]]<<endif>>

links.text: HE TILTS YOUR BRUISED FACE AROUND FOR THE WHOLE TABLE TO SEE
HE TILTS HUMPHREY'S BRUISED FACE AROUND FOR THE WHOLE TABLE TO SEE

passages.name: CHEWING ALL DAY HASN'T DENTED THE BOGEYMAN'S APPETITE1
passages.text:
When everyone has cleared their plates, he doesn't dismiss you straight away.

[[HE SITS BACK AND SIGHS]]

passages.name: bruise
passages.text:
{{{Alright, you're dismissed.}}}

[[THE FIVE OF YOU RISE]]

passages.name: SLEEP1
passages.text: <

destination.name: ALL OF YESTERDAY'S ACHES ARE BACK AND TWICE AS BIG

passages.name: ALL OF YESTERDAY'S ACHES ARE BACK AND TWICE AS BIG
passages.text:
You rise with the other children and follow them through the steps of your new routine.<<if $nofood>> You have to stop yourself from gobbling your breakfast after a day of starvation.<<endif>>

[[THE BOGEYMAN HAS NO SHORTAGE OF WAYS TO KEEP YOU BUSY]]

links.text: THE BOGEYMAN HAS NO SHORTAGE OF WAYS TO KEEP YOU BUSY

destination.name: THE BOGEYMAN HAS NO SHORTAGE OF WAYS TO KEEP YOU BUSY

passages.name: THE BOGEYMAN HAS NO SHORTAGE OF WAYS TO KEEP YOU BUSY
passages.text:
And when there's nothing that needs doing, he simply gives orders for things that don't need doing.

[[PETER NEARLY BREAKS HIS BACK CHECKING THE ROOF OF THE WOODSHED FOR NON-EXISTENT LEAKS]]

links.text: PETER NEARLY BREAKS HIS BACK CHECKING THE ROOF OF THE WOODSHED FOR NON-EXISTENT LEAKS

destination.name: PETER NEARLY BREAKS HIS BACK CHECKING THE ROOF OF THE WOODSHED FOR NON-EXISTENT LEAKS

passages.name: PETER NEARLY BREAKS HIS BACK CHECKING THE ROOF OF THE WOODSHED FOR NON-EXISTENT LEAKS
passages.text:
<<if $nofood>>\
<<if $takeblame>>After your failure on the first night and your attempt to protect Grace, the Bogeyman has evidently decided that you need to be whipped into shape.

[[HE SAYS IT'S FOR YOUR OWN GOOD|creep]]\
\
<<else>>Despite your failure on the first night, the Bogeyman seems to have warmed to you a little. Especially since Humphrey became the new focus of his anger by trying to protect Grace.

[[HE SAYS YOU SHOW PROMISE|creep]]<<endif>>\
\
<<else>>\
<<if $takeblame>>Perhaps encouraged by your success on the first night, the Bogeyman seems to have forgiven you quickly for your attempt to protect Grace.

[[HE SAYS YOU SHOW PROMISE|creep]]\
\
<<else>>Ever since your success on the first night, the Bogeyman seems to be nursing a sort of fondness for you, in his own way.

[[HE SAYS YOU SHOW A LOT OF PROMISE|creep]]<<endif>>\
<<endif>>

links.text: HE SAYS IT'S FOR YOUR OWN GOOD
HE SAYS YOU SHOW A LOT OF PROMISE

passages.name: creep
passages.text:
He expresses this by assigning you all the chores that keep you most closely under his watch: scrubbing his spit; trimming his nails; massaging his stomach when he eats too much.

[[HE REFUSES TO REMOVE HIS BOOTS WHILE YOU POLISH THEM]]

links.text: HE REFUSES TO REMOVE HIS BOOTS WHILE YOU POLISH THEM

destination.name: HE REFUSES TO REMOVE HIS BOOTS WHILE YOU POLISH THEM

passages.name: HE REFUSES TO REMOVE HIS BOOTS WHILE YOU POLISH THEM
passages.text:
So you kneel and shine the pothole-black leather, and endure his jokes about squashing your skull with one step because you know that he probably could if he wanted to.

[[THE DAYS PASS IN A BLUR OF WORK AND MILKY STUPOR AND PRAYERS OF GRATITUDE]]

links.text: THE DAYS PASS IN A BLUR OF WORK AND MILKY STUPOR AND PRAYERS OF GRATITUDE

destination.name: THE DAYS PASS IN A BLUR OF WORK AND MILKY STUPOR AND PRAYERS OF GRATITUDE

passages.name: THE DAYS PASS IN A BLUR OF WORK AND MILKY STUPOR AND PRAYERS OF GRATITUDE
passages.text:
Until the afternoon of the seventh day.

[[A SPECIAL TREAT]]

passages.name: A SPECIAL TREAT
passages.text:
The sun is shining, but Tabitha has been given the key to the trapdoor in the ceiling, in order to hunt out some items in the loft, and you are to help her.

<<if $takeblame>>[[GRACE HOLDS A CHAIR STEADY FOR YOU TO CLIMB UP|chair]]<<else>>[[HUMPHREY HOLDS A CHAIR STEADY FOR YOU TO CLIMB UP|chair]]<<endif>>

links.text: GRACE HOLDS A CHAIR STEADY FOR YOU TO CLIMB UP
HUMPHREY HOLDS A CHAIR STEADY FOR YOU TO CLIMB UP

passages.name: chair
passages.text:
<<if $takeblame>>"Don't get scared up there," she smiles up at you from the landing. "It's dark and spooky but it's not that bad!"<<else>>"Have fun," he calls up at you from the landing. "Remember it's probably not as haunted as it seems."<<endif>>

[[TABITHA CLOSES THE TRAPDOOR, SHUTTING YOU BOTH IN THE DARK]]

links.text: TABITHA CLOSES THE TRAPDOOR, SHUTTING YOU BOTH IN THE DARK

destination.name: TABITHA CLOSES THE TRAPDOOR, SHUTTING YOU BOTH IN THE DARK

passages.name: TABITHA CLOSES THE TRAPDOOR, SHUTTING YOU BOTH IN THE DARK
passages.text:
You hear her moving across from you. "Don't worry. Your eyes will adjust."

[[AND THEY DO, IN TIME]]

passages.name: AND THEY DO, IN TIME
passages.text:
The roof is barely high enough for you to crawl, never mind stand, and every inch of space is filled with junk. You understand why the Bogeyman doesn't come up here himself.

[[IT SMELLS LIKE DUST AND MILDEW]]

links.text: IT SMELLS LIKE DUST AND MILDEW

destination.name: IT SMELLS LIKE DUST AND MILDEW

passages.name: IT SMELLS LIKE DUST AND MILDEW
passages.text:
"Remember," says Tabitha, "any cloth is something we can use. We need to patch our blankets and clothes as well as his robes, and shoes are always a plus, if you can find them."

[[YOU BOTH START SEARCHING THROUGH THE PILES AND BOXES]]

links.text: YOU BOTH START SEARCHING THROUGH THE PILES AND BOXES

destination.name: YOU BOTH START SEARCHING THROUGH THE PILES AND BOXES

passages.name: YOU BOTH START SEARCHING THROUGH THE PILES AND BOXES
passages.text:
The stuff you find falls into two main categories. There are things which must be useful around the hovel from time to time: a hammer and a few bundles of nails, a stash of candles, a vase, a hand-powered drill.

[[AND THEN THERE ARE CHILDREN'S THINGS]]

links.text: AND THEN THERE ARE CHILDREN'S THINGS

destination.name: AND THEN THERE ARE CHILDREN'S THINGS

passages.name: AND THEN THERE ARE CHILDREN'S THINGS
passages.text:
Child-sized coats, dressing gowns, shoes and socks; ribbons, headbands, blankets and handkerchiefs with initials stitched into the corners. A few books. At least one recorder.

[[AND DOZENS OF TOYS]]

passages.name: AND DOZENS OF TOYS
passages.text:
Tabitha's head turns towards you in the dark. You can't make out her expression. "If there's anything you want to talk about," she says quietly, "now would be a good time."
[[STAY SILENT|silent]] [[WELL...]]

passages.name: silent
passages.text:
You get back to work in silence. On your side of the loft is a small cardboard box that has yet to be explored, as well as someone's forgotten school bag.
[[LOOK IN THE BOX]] [[LOOK IN THE BAG]]

passages.name: WELL...
passages.text:
"Well?" <>
[[WHERE DOES ALL THIS STUFF COME FROM]] [[HOW LONG HAVE YOU BEEN HERE]]
[[I WANT TO GO HOME]] [[NEVER MIND|silent]]

links.text: WHERE DOES ALL THIS STUFF COME FROM

destination.name: WHERE DOES ALL THIS STUFF COME FROM

links.text: HOW LONG HAVE YOU BEEN HERE

destination.name: HOW LONG HAVE YOU BEEN HERE

passages.name: WHERE DOES ALL THIS STUFF COME FROM
passages.text:
"It's just whatever kids have with them when he puts them in the sack. I was like you – I didn't have anything, except the clothes I was wearing. But a lot of them do, and it builds up over time."

[[DO NEW KIDS REALLY SHOW UP THAT OFTEN]]

links.text: DO NEW KIDS REALLY SHOW UP THAT OFTEN

destination.name: DO NEW KIDS REALLY SHOW UP THAT OFTEN

passages.name: HOW LONG HAVE YOU BEEN HERE
passages.text:
"Honestly... I don't know. The seasons aren't much to go on here. But I've seen hundreds of others come and go."

[[AND HE STILL HASN'T LET YOU GO HOME]]

links.text: AND HE STILL HASN'T LET YOU GO HOME

destination.name: AND HE STILL HASN'T LET YOU GO HOME

passages.name: I WANT TO GO HOME
passages.text:
"Don't worry. <<if $nofood and $takeblame>>You got off to a rocky start here but you'll be fine, as long as you're lucky.<<else>>I think he likes you. You'll be fine, as long as you stay lucky.<<endif>>"

[[WHAT IF I'M UNLUCKY]]

passages.name: WHAT IF I'M UNLUCKY
passages.text:
"... Well. Either way, you won't be stuck here forever."

[[SHE QUICKLY TURNS BACK TO HER WORK|silent]]

links.text: SHE QUICKLY TURNS BACK TO HER WORK

passages.name: DO NEW KIDS REALLY SHOW UP THAT OFTEN
passages.text:
"Every week. One in, one out, so there's always five of us. ... They don't all get to go home, you know. In case you were wondering."

[[SHE QUICKLY TURNS BACK TO HER WORK|silent]]

links.text: SHE QUICKLY TURNS BACK TO HER WORK

passages.name: AND HE STILL HASN'T LET YOU GO HOME
passages.text:
"... Most of the others didn't get to go home, either, you know. There's more than one way out of here. ... Sometimes I think I'm the lucky one."

[[SHE QUICKLY TURNS BACK TO HER WORK|silent]]

links.text: SHE QUICKLY TURNS BACK TO HER WORK

passages.name: IT'S HARD TO KEEP TRACK OF TIME PASSING UP HERE
passages.text:
You must have been hunting through the junk for at least another hour when you notice that Tabitha has stopped.

[[GLANCE OVER AND SEE HER STARING DOWN AT SOMETHING IN HER HANDS]]

links.text: GLANCE OVER AND SEE HER STARING DOWN AT SOMETHING IN HER HANDS

destination.name: GLANCE OVER AND SEE HER STARING DOWN AT SOMETHING IN HER HANDS

passages.name: SHE CUTS HERSELF OFF, PAUSES
passages.text:
"Do you ever wonder why I haven't already tried to smash his head in with a shovel?"

[[OR POISON HIS FOOD|poison]]

passages.name: OR POISON HIS FOOD
passages.text:
"I've stayed here so long. Staying any longer isn't an option. You'll understand more by the end of today. But staying isn't an option."

[[THEN SHE FORCES A SMILE]]

passages.name: THEN SHE FORCES A SMILE
passages.text:
"Sorry if I'm being off. It's not you – I like you. I just hate Sundays, that's all."

[[SHE TOSSES YOU A NEW PAIR OF SOCKS TO TRY WITH THE PUMPS]]

links.text: SHE TOSSES YOU A NEW PAIR OF SOCKS TO TRY WITH THE PUMPS

destination.name: SHE TOSSES YOU A NEW PAIR OF SOCKS TO TRY WITH THE PUMPS

passages.name: SHE TOSSES YOU A NEW PAIR OF SOCKS TO TRY WITH THE PUMPS
passages.text:
You keep yourselves busy in the loft for the rest of the day, until a tap on the trapdoor brings you back to reality.

[[PETER IS STANDING ON THE LANDING WITH A BROOM, LOOKING GRIM]]

links.text: PETER IS STANDING ON THE LANDING WITH A BROOM, LOOKING GRIM

destination.name: PETER IS STANDING ON THE LANDING WITH A BROOM, LOOKING GRIM

passages.name: PETER IS STANDING ON THE LANDING WITH A BROOM, LOOKING GRIM
passages.text:
Dinner's ready, he says. You drop your findings to him through the hatchway, before helping each other climb down onto the chair.

[[TABITHA SEEMS SOLEMN AS SHE LOCKS THE TRAPDOOR BEHIND HER]]

links.text: TABITHA SEEMS SOLEMN AS SHE LOCKS THE TRAPDOOR BEHIND HER

destination.name: TABITHA SEEMS SOLEMN AS SHE LOCKS THE TRAPDOOR BEHIND HER

passages.name: TABITHA SEEMS SOLEMN AS SHE LOCKS THE TRAPDOOR BEHIND HER
passages.text:
You're at the top of the stairs, about to join the others in the kitchen, when Peter pulls you aside and into the bedroom. "Hey," he whispers.

[[HEY]]

passages.name: HEY
passages.text:
"Did Tabitha say anything weird while you were up there?"
[[YEAH, PRETTY WEIRD|weird]] [[NOPE, NOTHING WEIRD|weird]]

passages.name: weird
passages.text:
He frowns. "Okay," he says. "Okay. Let's go and have dinner. Just remember, if you – whatever happens. We're your friends. We know how you feel."

[[GO AND HAVE DINNER]]

passages.name: GO AND HAVE DINNER
passages.text:
You descend to the kitchen, where <<if $takeblame>>Humphrey<<else>>Grace<<endif>> and Tabitha are already waiting at their chairs.

[[FOR THE FIRST TIME ALL WEEK, IT SMELLS DELICIOUS]]

links.text: FOR THE FIRST TIME ALL WEEK, IT SMELLS DELICIOUS

destination.name: FOR THE FIRST TIME ALL WEEK, IT SMELLS DELICIOUS

passages.name: THE BOGEYMAN IS DOING THE COOKING
passages.text:
{{{There you are!}}} He greets you over his shoulder from where he's taking the meat out of the oven. I didn't want you to be late for your first Sunday dinner with us. Are you hungry,<> <> my <>little fish?
[[YES, SIR]] [[NOT REALLY|no]]

passages.name: YES, SIR
passages.text:
{{{That's the spirit,}}} he beams, bringing the roast over to the table and setting it down with an air of pride.

[[YOUR STOMACH LURCHES]]

passages.name: YOUR STOMACH LURCHES
passages.text:
You can look at it any way you want, trying to convince yourself it's a bird, but you know what it is.

[[THE TABLE IS SET FOR FIVE]]

links.text: THE TABLE IS SET FOR FIVE

destination.name: THE TABLE IS SET FOR FIVE

passages.name: THE TABLE IS SET FOR FIVE
passages.text: The Bogeyman seems delighted with the dead silence in the room, and with the look on your face. {{{Let's take a moment to reflect,}}} he intones, on the virtue of <>industry<>honesty<>, and the consequences of <>failure<>deceit<>. [[HE POURS HIMSELF A BLACK DRINK FROM A BLACK BOTTLE]]

links.text: HE POURS HIMSELF A BLACK DRINK FROM A BLACK BOTTLE

destination.name: HE POURS HIMSELF A BLACK DRINK FROM A BLACK BOTTLE

passages.name: HE POURS HIMSELF A BLACK DRINK FROM A BLACK BOTTLE
passages.text:
{{{And remember, when we think of 'taking sides' – }}}he raises the glass, looks straight at you{{{ – that there's only one winning side in this house. Cheers.}}}

[[SIT]]

passages.name: SIT
passages.text:
Peter and Tabitha both shoot you sympathetic glances as you take your seats. <<if $takeblame>>Humphrey is glaring down at the tablecloth.<<else>>Grace is looking down at the tablecloth, holding back tears.<<endif>>

[[THE BOGEYMAN CARVES A SLICE OFF THE ROAST AND PUTS IT ON YOUR PLATE]]

links.text: THE BOGEYMAN CARVES A SLICE OFF THE ROAST AND PUTS IT ON YOUR PLATE

destination.name: THE BOGEYMAN CARVES A SLICE OFF THE ROAST AND PUTS IT ON YOUR PLATE

passages.name: THE BOGEYMAN CARVES A SLICE OFF THE ROAST AND PUTS IT ON YOUR PLATE
passages.text:
{{{Be patient, now,}}} he grins, already serving the others. {{{Wait until everybody's got their helping.}}}

[[THE FLESH ON YOUR PLATE IS OOZING PINK]]

links.text: THE FLESH ON YOUR PLATE IS OOZING PINK

destination.name: THE FLESH ON YOUR PLATE IS OOZING PINK

passages.name: THE FLESH ON YOUR PLATE IS OOZING PINK
passages.text:
<<if $takeblame>>He takes his time carving himself a decent slice. {{{God, they're so tender at this age. But she never had much meat on her bones to start with, hmm?}}}<<else>>He's saved himself the tongue. It sits coiled on his plate in a pool of its own juices. {{{I did warn him I'd have it, didn't I?}}}<<endif>>

[[HE NUDGES YOU LIKE IT'S YOUR OWN LITTLE JOKE|drool]]

links.text: HE NUDGES YOU LIKE IT'S YOUR OWN LITTLE JOKE

passages.name: drool
passages.text: He licks his lips, lets a string of drool escape off his chin onto the table. Well, dig in, children. Before <>she<>he<> gets cold. [[EVERYONE STARTS EATING]]

passages.name: EVERYONE STARTS EATING
passages.text:
The other children pick silently at their meat. Tabitha is keeping her face carefully neutral, while <<if $takeblame>>Humphrey<<else>>Grace<<endif>> looks more queasy.

[[THE BOGEYMAN SHOVELS HIS SERVING DOWN IN THREE BITES]]

links.text: THE BOGEYMAN SHOVELS HIS SERVING DOWN IN THREE BITES

destination.name: THE BOGEYMAN SHOVELS HIS SERVING DOWN IN THREE BITES

passages.name: THE BOGEYMAN SHOVELS HIS SERVING DOWN IN THREE BITES
passages.text:
Then sits back, enjoying your collective discomfort with equal relish. {{{Don't be squeamish, little fish,}}} he leers at you in particular. {{{This is the best meat you'll get. Until next week.}}}

[[THAT'S PROBABLY TRUE]]

passages.name: AND IT'S NOT YOUR FAULT
passages.text:
When everyone's plate is clear, he picks up the knife again. {{{Does anybody want seconds?}}}

[[NOBODY WANTS SECONDS]]

passages.name: NOBODY WANTS SECONDS
passages.text:
{{{What a pity. More for me, I suppose.}}}

<<if $takeblame>>[[HE PUTS DOWN THE KNIFE AND PICKS UP THE REMAINS OF GRACE'S CARCASS IN BOTH HANDS|tear]]<<else>>[[HE PUTS DOWN THE KNIFE AND PICKS UP THE REMAINS OF HUMPHREY'S CARCASS IN BOTH HANDS|tear]]<<endif>>

links.text: HE PUTS DOWN THE KNIFE AND PICKS UP THE REMAINS OF GRACE'S CARCASS IN BOTH HANDS
HE PUTS DOWN THE KNIFE AND PICKS UP THE REMAINS OF HUMPHREY'S CARCASS IN BOTH HANDS

passages.name: tear
passages.text:
And tears into it with his teeth, spraying spit and meat juice as he chews. It's so loud in the silence – the only other sound to be heard is the grunt of pleasure he makes around every mouthful.

[[YOU'VE NEVER ENJOYED ANY MEAL AS MUCH AS THE BOGEYMAN IS ENJOYING THIS]]

links.text: YOU'VE NEVER ENJOYED ANY MEAL AS MUCH AS THE BOGEYMAN IS ENJOYING THIS

destination.name: YOU'VE NEVER ENJOYED ANY MEAL AS MUCH AS THE BOGEYMAN IS ENJOYING THIS

passages.name: YOU'VE NEVER ENJOYED ANY MEAL AS MUCH AS THE BOGEYMAN IS ENJOYING THIS
passages.text:
At last, he drops <<if $takeblame>>Grace's<<else>>Humphrey's<<endif>> bones on the table and slumps back in his chair, out of breath.

[[HE BECKONS YOU TO RUB HIS SWOLLEN STOMACH]]

links.text: HE BECKONS YOU TO RUB HIS SWOLLEN STOMACH

destination.name: HE BECKONS YOU TO RUB HIS SWOLLEN STOMACH

passages.name: HE BECKONS YOU TO RUB HIS SWOLLEN STOMACH
passages.text:
Tabitha, Peter and <<if $takeblame>>Humphrey<<else>>Grace<<endif>> start clearing the table while you take up position, kneeling beside his chair.

[[HE LETS OUT A BURP THAT SUGGESTS SEVERAL MORE TO COME]]

links.text: HE LETS OUT A BURP THAT SUGGESTS SEVERAL MORE TO COME

destination.name: HE LETS OUT A BURP THAT SUGGESTS SEVERAL MORE TO COME

passages.name: HE LETS OUT A BURP THAT SUGGESTS SEVERAL MORE TO COME
passages.text: {{{Oof... working with kids has its perks, you know?}}} He grins sleepily, meat-stained from ear to ear, as you work over his gut. Can you feel <>her<>him<> kicking? [[YOU ALMOST THINK YOU CAN]]

passages.name: YOU ALMOST THINK YOU CAN
passages.text:
Don't worry. I'll go out tonight and fetch a new little friend for you, someone twice as <>pathetic as Grace<>snotty as Humphrey<>. Who shall I snatch this time, fish? Any requests?
[[A BOY]] [[A GIRL]]

passages.name: THAT'S PROBABLY TRUE
passages.text:
It tastes good.

[[AND IT'S NOT YOUR FAULT]]

passages.name: A BOY
passages.text:
<<set $boy = true>>\
\
<<if $takeblame>>{{{Fair enough. The girls have been causing more than their fair of trouble lately, hmm? No promises, but I'll see what I can do.}}}<<else>>{{{Good idea. Restore the balance a bit, now that Humphrey is no longer with us. No promises, but I'll see what I can do.}}}<<endif>>

[[HE LOWERS HIS VOICE SO ONLY YOU CAN HEAR|kid]]

links.text: HE LOWERS HIS VOICE SO ONLY YOU CAN HEAR

passages.name: A GIRL
passages.text:
<<if $takeblame>>{{{Good idea. Restore the balance a bit, now that Grace is no longer with us. No promises, but I'll see what I can do.}}}<<else>>{{{Fair enough. The boys have been causing more than their fair of trouble lately, hmm? No promises, but I'll see what I can do.}}}<<endif>>

[[HE LOWERS HIS VOICE SO ONLY YOU CAN HEAR|kid]]

links.text: HE LOWERS HIS VOICE SO ONLY YOU CAN HEAR

passages.name: kid
passages.text:
<>{{{I know you and I got off to a rocky start this week, fish. It's okay. I just want you to know that your time here could be painless, if you only learn to do as you're told. Understand?}}}<>{{{You've been a good example to the others since you got here, fish. I want you to know that your time here could be painless, if you just keep it up.}}}<>
[[I WILL]] [[...]]

passages.name: I WILL
passages.text:
<<set $iwill = true>>{{{I know you will.}}}

[[HE TOUSELS YOUR HAIR AND SMILES]]

links.text: HE TOUSELS YOUR HAIR AND SMILES

destination.name: HE TOUSELS YOUR HAIR AND SMILES

passages.text:
He sighs. {{{Alright. Anyway, I'm going to take a digestion nap before I go.}}}

[[TIME FOR YOUR MILK]]

passages.name: TIME FOR YOUR MILK
passages.text: With the kitchen clean and tidy, you and the other children – the survivors – resume your places at the table and take your glasses in turn. [[YOUR GLASS IS A LITTLE MORE FULL THAN IT WAS EARLIER IN THE WEEK]]

links.text: YOUR GLASS IS A LITTLE MORE FULL THAN IT WAS EARLIER IN THE WEEK

destination.name: YOUR GLASS IS A LITTLE MORE FULL THAN IT WAS EARLIER IN THE WEEK

passages.name: HE TOUSELS YOUR HAIR AND SMILES
passages.text:
{{{Alright. Anyway, I'm going to take a digestion nap before I go.}}}

[[TIME FOR YOUR MILK]]

passages.name: YOUR GLASS IS A LITTLE MORE FULL THAN IT WAS EARLIER IN THE WEEK
passages.text:
It makes sense; your body is already getting used to it. You still sleep like a log every night, but you haven't felt dizzy and limp since that first glass. The longer you stay here, the more you'll have to drink.

[[YOU WONDER WHERE HE GETS IT FROM]]

links.text: YOU WONDER WHERE HE GETS IT FROM

destination.name: YOU WONDER WHERE HE GETS IT FROM

passages.name: LOOK IN THE BOX
passages.text:
Inside the box, under a nest of cobwebs and crumbling newspaper, you hit the jackpot: a pair of pumps with barely any holes in them.

[[THEY MAY SMELL QUESTIONABLE BUT THEY'RE ONLY ONE SIZE TOO BIG FOR YOU]]

links.text: THEY MAY SMELL QUESTIONABLE BUT THEY'RE ONLY ONE SIZE TOO BIG FOR YOU

destination.name: THEY MAY SMELL QUESTIONABLE BUT THEY'RE ONLY ONE SIZE TOO BIG FOR YOU

passages.name: LOOK IN THE BAG
passages.text:
At the bottom of the bag, under a layer of cobwebbed gym shorts, you hit the jackpot: a pair of pumps with barely any holes in them.

[[THEY MAY SMELL QUESTIONABLE BUT THEY'RE ONLY ONE SIZE TOO BIG FOR YOU]]

links.text: THEY MAY SMELL QUESTIONABLE BUT THEY'RE ONLY ONE SIZE TOO BIG FOR YOU

destination.name: THEY MAY SMELL QUESTIONABLE BUT THEY'RE ONLY ONE SIZE TOO BIG FOR YOU

passages.name: THEY MAY SMELL QUESTIONABLE BUT THEY'RE ONLY ONE SIZE TOO BIG FOR YOU
passages.text:
They should limit the number of cuts and calluses and splinters to your feet, if you can only find a pair of socks thick enough to make them wearable.

[[YOU WILL GROW INTO THEM IF YOU STAY HERE LONG ENOUGH|IT'S HARD TO KEEP TRACK OF TIME PASSING UP HERE]]

links.text: YOU WILL GROW INTO THEM IF YOU STAY HERE LONG ENOUGH

destination.name: IT'S HARD TO KEEP TRACK OF TIME PASSING UP HERE

passages.name: no
passages.text:
{{{Well, just wait until you see what we've got for you!}}} He carries the roast over to the table and sets it down, beaming.

[[YOUR STOMACH LURCHES]]

passages.name: FOR THE FIRST TIME ALL WEEK, IT SMELLS DELICIOUS
passages.text:
The table is set, the lamp turning everything a warm orange. There's a big dish of roasted vegetables which look like they might actually taste of something other than dirt. And another first:

[[THE BOGEYMAN IS DOING THE COOKING]]

links.text: THE BOGEYMAN IS DOING THE COOKING

destination.name: THE BOGEYMAN IS DOING THE COOKING

passages.name: GO UP TO BED IN A DAZE
passages.text:
You curl up on the floor, clutching Claire's comb, the closest thing you have to a toy of your own. Across the room is the empty ragpile that used to be <<if $takeblame>>Grace<<else>>Humphrey<<endif>>'s.

<<if $takeblame>>[[YOU CAN HEAR HUMPHREY SNIFFLING EVEN AS HE SUCCUMBS TO SLEEP|awake]]<<else>>[[YOU CAN HEAR GRACE SNIFFLING EVEN AS SHE SUCCUMBS TO SLEEP|awake]]<<endif>>

links.text: YOU CAN HEAR HUMPHREY SNIFFLING EVEN AS HE SUCCUMBS TO SLEEP
YOU CAN HEAR GRACE SNIFFLING EVEN AS SHE SUCCUMBS TO SLEEP

passages.name: awake
passages.text:
The last thing you're aware of is the faint outline of Tabitha, sitting up with her back to the wall,

[[MOONLIGHT POOLING IN HER WIDE-AWAKE EYES]]

links.text: MOONLIGHT POOLING IN HER WIDE-AWAKE EYES

destination.name: MOONLIGHT POOLING IN HER WIDE-AWAKE EYES

passages.name: YOU WONDER WHERE HE GETS IT FROM
passages.text:
And how long it would take before it stopped affecting you altogether.

[[A YEAR OR MORE]]

passages.name: A YEAR OR MORE
passages.text:
All wonderings soon leave your head for the night, submerged in merciful milk-sludge.

[[GO UP TO BED IN A DAZE]]

links.text: GO UP TO BED IN A DAZE

destination.name: GO UP TO BED IN A DAZE

passages.name: MOONLIGHT POOLING IN HER WIDE-AWAKE EYES
passages.text: <<goto "week2">>

passages.name: week2title
passages.text: <

passages.name: THE FRONT DOOR SLAMMING
passages.text:
The first rays of another desaturated dawn are spreading across the room. From downstairs, you feel more than hear the vibrations of the Bogeyman's boots.

[[A COLD DRAFT SWIRLS ABOUT YOU]]

links.text: A COLD DRAFT SWIRLS ABOUT YOU

destination.name: A COLD DRAFT SWIRLS ABOUT YOU

passages.name: A COLD DRAFT SWIRLS ABOUT YOU
passages.text:
Shivering, you pull your rags closer and look around.

[[MIST IS SPILLING IN THROUGH THE OPEN WINDOW]]

links.text: MIST IS SPILLING IN THROUGH THE OPEN WINDOW

destination.name: MIST IS SPILLING IN THROUGH THE OPEN WINDOW

passages.name: MIST IS SPILLING IN THROUGH THE OPEN WINDOW
passages.text:
Peter is snoring softly, sprawled on his front. <<if $takeblame>>Humphrey<<else>>Grace<<endif>> is visible only as a lump beneath <<if $takeblame>>his<<else>>her<<endif>> rags, rising and falling with each breath.

[[TABITHA IS NOWHERE TO BE SEEN]]

links.text: TABITHA IS NOWHERE TO BE SEEN

destination.name: TABITHA IS NOWHERE TO BE SEEN

passages.name: TABITHA IS NOWHERE TO BE SEEN
passages.text:
And Claire's comb is lying by the wall, all but one of its teeth snapped off. Now those boots are coming up the stairs.
[[GO TO THE DOOR]] [[GO TO THE WINDOW]]

passages.name: GO TO THE DOOR
passages.text:
You tiptoe over to the door and open it quietly<<if $door>>, like Tabitha showed you on your first day<<endif>>.

[[YOU RUN STRAIGHT INTO A WALL OF BLACK CLOTH|YOU'RE STILL TRYING THE HANDLE WHEN YOU HEAR THE BOLT BEING SCRAPED BACK]]

links.text: YOU RUN STRAIGHT INTO A WALL OF BLACK CLOTH

destination.name: YOU'RE STILL TRYING THE HANDLE WHEN YOU HEAR THE BOLT BEING SCRAPED BACK

passages.name: GO TO THE WINDOW
passages.text:
You tiptoe over to the window. The lock has been picked with something – when you bash it, a tiny spoke of pale plastic rattles to the floor.

[[A COMB TOOTH]]

passages.name: A COMB TOOTH
passages.text:
Peering out of the window, you can't see anything else out of place. No footprints, no rope of bedsheets, no sign of Tabitha.

[[BEHIND YOU, THE DOOR CREAKS]]

passages.name: BEHIND YOU, THE DOOR CREAKS
passages.text:
You turn to see the Bogeyman standing in the open doorway, lumpy sack in one hand, half-eaten turnip in the other. He looks down at you in surprise, then from the open window to Tabitha's empty bed in a matter of seconds.

[[YOU SEE HIM RELAX|close window]]

passages.name: YOU'RE STILL TRYING THE HANDLE WHEN YOU HEAR THE BOLT BEING SCRAPED BACK
passages.text:
The Bogeyman stands in the doorway, lumpy sack in one hand, half-eaten turnip in the other. He looks down at you in surprise, then from the open window to Tabitha's empty bed in a matter of seconds.

[[YOU SEE HIM RELAX|close window]]

passages.name: YOU SEE HIM RELAX
passages.text:
{{{We'll talk about this later.}}}

[[THEN HE UPENDS THE SACK AND A BODY TUMBLES ONTO THE FLOOR]]\
\
<<if $boy>>\
<<set $newkid = "Christopher">><<set $he = "he">><<set $his = "his">><<set $him = "him">><<set $capitalHis = "His">><<set $capitalHe = "He">>\
<<else>>\
<<set $newkid = "Jennifer">><<set $he = "she">><<set $his = "her">><<set $him = "her">><<set $capitalHis = "Her">><<set $capitalHe = "She">>\
<<endif>>

links.text: THEN HE UPENDS THE SACK AND A BODY TUMBLES ONTO THE FLOOR

destination.name: THEN HE UPENDS THE SACK AND A BODY TUMBLES ONTO THE FLOOR

passages.name: THEN HE UPENDS THE SACK AND A BODY TUMBLES ONTO THE FLOOR
passages.text:
<<if $newkid eq "Christopher">>It's a little boy who yelps and sits up, blinking away sleep and pushing curly hair out of his eyes.<<else>>It's a little girl who yelps and sits up, blinking away sleep and pushing curly hair out of her eyes.<<endif>>

<<if $newkid eq "Christopher">>[[HE LOOKS UP AT THE BOGEYMAN IN HORROR]]<<else>>[[SHE LOOKS UP AT THE BOGEYMAN IN HORROR|HE LOOKS UP AT THE BOGEYMAN IN HORROR]]<<endif>>

links.text: HE LOOKS UP AT THE BOGEYMAN IN HORROR

destination.name: HE LOOKS UP AT THE BOGEYMAN IN HORROR

links.text: SHE LOOKS UP AT THE BOGEYMAN IN HORROR

destination.name: HE LOOKS UP AT THE BOGEYMAN IN HORROR

passages.name: HE LOOKS UP AT THE BOGEYMAN IN HORROR
passages.text:
<<if $newkid eq "Christopher">>{{{Wake up, children. Your new friend is here. A boy, as requested.}}}<<else>>{{{Wake up, children. Your new friend is here. A girl, as requested.}}}<<endif>>

[[HE TAKES A BITE OUT OF THE TURNIP]]

links.text: HE TAKES A BITE OUT OF THE TURNIP

destination.name: HE TAKES A BITE OUT OF THE TURNIP

passages.name: HE TAKES A BITE OUT OF THE TURNIP
passages.text:
Peter and <<if $takeblame>>Humphrey<<else>>Grace<<endif>> are stirring now. They listlessly take in the new arrival before turning, bewildered, to Tabitha's empty bed.

[[THEY LOOK TO THE BOGEYMAN FOR AN EXPLANATION, BUT HE'S ALREADY LEAVING]]

links.text: THEY LOOK TO THE BOGEYMAN FOR AN EXPLANATION, BUT HE'S ALREADY LEAVING

destination.name: THEY LOOK TO THE BOGEYMAN FOR AN EXPLANATION, BUT HE'S ALREADY LEAVING

passages.name: THEY LOOK TO THE BOGEYMAN FOR AN EXPLANATION, BUT HE'S ALREADY LEAVING
passages.text:
{{{It's just a Monday like any other, children. That means I'm going to bed, and I'd better not hear a peep out of any of you until dinner, or else.}}}

[[WITH THAT, THE FOUR OF YOU ARE LEFT ALONE]]

links.text: WITH THAT, THE FOUR OF YOU ARE LEFT ALONE

destination.name: WITH THAT, THE FOUR OF YOU ARE LEFT ALONE

passages.name: WITH THAT, THE FOUR OF YOU ARE LEFT ALONE
passages.text:
<>The new boy looks at you, utterly lost. He seems like he has a hundred questions to ask but can't make his mouth work.<>The new girl looks at you, utterly lost. She seems like she has a hundred questions to ask but can't make her mouth work.<> <>
[[SMILE AT HIM|SMILE AT HER]] [[LOOK AWAY]]
<>
[[SMILE AT HER]] [[LOOK AWAY]]
<>

passages.name: SMILE AT HER
passages.text:
<<print $capitalHe>> smiles back gratefully, pulled back from the brink of panic by the sight of a friendly face.

<<if $newkid eq "Christopher">>[[THOUGH HE'S STILL TREMBLING WHEN HE SPEAKS|trembling]]<<else>>[[THOUGH SHE'S STILL TREMBLING WHEN SHE SPEAKS|trembling]]<<endif>>

links.text: THOUGH HE'S STILL TREMBLING WHEN HE SPEAKS
THOUGH SHE'S STILL TREMBLING WHEN SHE SPEAKS

passages.name: LOOK AWAY
passages.text:
<<print $capitalHe>> starts trembling. Peter wraps an arm around <<print $his>> shoulder. "It's okay. Don't be scared. What's your name?"

<<if $newkid eq "Christopher">>[[HE ANSWERS IN A SMALL VOICE|trembling]]<<else>>[[SHE ANSWERS IN A SMALL VOICE|trembling]]<<endif>>

links.text: HE ANSWERS IN A SMALL VOICE
SHE ANSWERS IN A SMALL VOICE

passages.name: trembling
passages.text:
"I'm <<print $newkid>>. I don't... what is this place? //Who was that man?"//

[[PETER DOES HIS NERVOUS LAUGH]]

passages.name: PETER DOES HIS NERVOUS LAUGH
passages.text:
"Did your parents ever tell you what happens to naughty children, <<print $newkid>>?"

<<if $newkid eq "Christopher">>[[CHRISTOPHER GOES WIDE-EYED|eyed]]<<else>>[[JENNIFER GOES WIDE-EYED|eyed]]<<endif>>

passages.name: eyed
passages.text:
<<print $capitalHe>> whispers, "Am I here because I didn't brush my teeth before bed?"

[[PETER SHRUGS]]

passages.name: PETER SHRUGS
passages.text:
"It could be that. It could be anything, really."

[[IRONICALLY WE DON'T GET TO BRUSH OUR TEETH HERE EVEN IF WE WANTED TO]]

links.text: IRONICALLY WE DON'T GET TO BRUSH OUR TEETH HERE EVEN IF WE WANTED TO

destination.name: IRONICALLY WE DON'T GET TO BRUSH OUR TEETH HERE EVEN IF WE WANTED TO

passages.name: IRONICALLY WE DON'T GET TO BRUSH OUR TEETH HERE EVEN IF WE WANTED TO
passages.text:
<> turns to you. "Why are you here? Did you forget to brush your teeth, too?"
[[NO, NOTHING AS TERRIBLE AS THAT]] [[NO, SOMETHING MUCH WORSE THAN THAT]]
[[YES, THAT'S EXACTLY WHAT HAPPENED]]

links.text: NO, NOTHING AS TERRIBLE AS THAT

destination.name: NO, NOTHING AS TERRIBLE AS THAT

links.text: NO, SOMETHING MUCH WORSE THAN THAT

destination.name: NO, SOMETHING MUCH WORSE THAN THAT

passages.name: NO, NOTHING AS TERRIBLE AS THAT
passages.text:
<<print $newkid>> looks ashamed. "I didn't – I – I wasn't //trying// to be bad. I just forgot."

<<if $newkid eq "Christopher">>[[FLUSTERED, HE TURNS THE SAME QUESTION TO PETER|piano]]<<else>>[[FLUSTERED, SHE TURNS THE SAME QUESTION TO PETER|piano]]<<endif>>

links.text: FLUSTERED, HE TURNS THE SAME QUESTION TO PETER
FLUSTERED, SHE TURNS THE SAME QUESTION TO PETER

passages.name: NO, SOMETHING MUCH WORSE THAN THAT
passages.text:
<<print $newkid>> gawks at you, half frightened, half impressed.

<<if $newkid eq "Christopher">>[[NERVOUS, HE TURNS THE SAME QUESTION TO PETER|piano]]<<else>>[[NERVOUS, SHE TURNS THE SAME QUESTION TO PETER|piano]]<<endif>>

links.text: NERVOUS, HE TURNS THE SAME QUESTION TO PETER
NERVOUS, SHE TURNS THE SAME QUESTION TO PETER

passages.name: YES, THAT'S EXACTLY WHAT HAPPENED
passages.text:
<<print $newkid>> nods sagely. "It's hard to remember sometimes. Toothpaste tastes really bad."

<<if $newkid eq "Christopher">>[[HE TURNS THE SAME QUESTION TO PETER|piano]]<<else>>[[SHE TURNS THE SAME QUESTION TO PETER|piano]]<<endif>>

links.text: HE TURNS THE SAME QUESTION TO PETER
SHE TURNS THE SAME QUESTION TO PETER

passages.name: piano
passages.text:
Peter goes bashful. "It was dumb. I didn't want to do my piano recital. So I hid inside the piano."
[[THAT IS PRETTY DUMB|THAT IS DUMB]] [[THAT'S REALLY SMART]]

passages.name: THAT IS DUMB
passages.text:
He shuffles his feet. "I know. I was in there for hours while they looked for me. By then I was too scared to come out. I guess I must have fallen asleep, because I woke up here."

<<if $takeblame>>[[ACROSS THE ROOM, HUMPHREY STANDS UP|stirs]]<<else>>[[ACROSS THE ROOM, GRACE STANDS UP|stirs]]<<endif>>

links.text: ACROSS THE ROOM, HUMPHREY STANDS UP
ACROSS THE ROOM, GRACE STANDS UP

passages.name: THAT'S REALLY SMART
passages.text:
"Thanks." He shuffles his feet. "I didn't feel smart at the time. I was in there for hours while they looked for me. By then I was too scared to come out. I guess I fell asleep, because I woke up here."

<<if $takeblame>>[[ACROSS THE ROOM, HUMPHREY STANDS UP|stirs]]<<else>>[[ACROSS THE ROOM, GRACE STANDS UP|stirs]]<<endif>>

links.text: ACROSS THE ROOM, HUMPHREY STANDS UP
ACROSS THE ROOM, GRACE STANDS UP

passages.name: stirs
passages.text:
<<if $takeblame>>He<<else>>She<<endif>> pads over to the door and onto the landing without even looking at any of you. Seconds later, you hear the faint creak of <<if $takeblame>>his<<else>>her<<endif>> footsteps on the stairs.

[[PETER SHOOTS YOU A GLANCE]]

passages.name: PETER SHOOTS YOU A GLANCE
passages.text:
"Let's just get to work," he whispers. "One of us should show <> the ropes, so maybe the other one can keep an eye on <>? <>She<>He<> seems a bit... off."
<>[[I'LL LOOK AFTER CHRISTOPHER|newkid]]<>[[I'LL LOOK AFTER JENNIFER|newkid]]<> <>[[I'LL LOOK AFTER GRACE|survivor]]<>[[I'LL LOOK AFTER HUMPHREY|survivor]]<>

passages.name: close window
passages.text:
{{{Don't worry. I know it wasn't you.}}}

[[HE STOMPS OVER TO THE WINDOW AND SLAMS IT SHUT, CLICKING THE LOCK BACK INTO PLACE|YOU SEE HIM RELAX]]

links.text: HE STOMPS OVER TO THE WINDOW AND SLAMS IT SHUT, CLICKING THE LOCK BACK INTO PLACE

passages.name: newkid
passages.text:
<<set $watchkid = true>>"Good idea. I think you know your way around well enough by now."

[[THE THREE OF YOU TIPTOE DOWN TO THE KITCHEN]]

links.text: THE THREE OF YOU TIPTOE DOWN TO THE KITCHEN

destination.name: THE THREE OF YOU TIPTOE DOWN TO THE KITCHEN

passages.name: survivor
passages.text:
"Good idea. You've only been here a week, after all."

[[THE THREE OF YOU TIPTOE DOWN TO THE KITCHEN]]

links.text: THE THREE OF YOU TIPTOE DOWN TO THE KITCHEN

destination.name: THE THREE OF YOU TIPTOE DOWN TO THE KITCHEN

passages.name: THE THREE OF YOU TIPTOE DOWN TO THE KITCHEN
passages.text:
The day unfolds much like your first day here. You tidy the turnips, scrub the floor, scour the oven, build the fire.

[[AND KEEP AN EYE ON YOUR CHARGE]]

links.text: AND KEEP AN EYE ON YOUR CHARGE

destination.name: AND KEEP AN EYE ON YOUR CHARGE

passages.name: AND KEEP AN EYE ON YOUR CHARGE
passages.text:
<<if $watchkid>><<print $newkid>> seems to have decided to look up to you. <<print $capitalHe>> asks a lot of questions about you and the other children, and about the Bogeyman and life in the hovel. When it comes time to boil the bones, you pray <<print $he>> won't ask where they came from.\
<<else>>\
<<print $survivor>> silently resists all attempts to cheer <<if $survivor eq "Grace">>her<<else>>him<<endif>> up, staring off into space until you give <<if $survivor eq "Grace">>her<<else>>him<<endif>> something to do.<<endif>>

[[IT KEEPS YOU OCCUPIED]]

passages.name: IT KEEPS YOU OCCUPIED
passages.text:
<<if $watchkid>>Meanwhile, <<print $survivor>> silently resists all Peter's attempts to cheer <<if $survivor eq "Grace">>her<<else>>him<<endif>> up, staring into space until given something to do.\
<<else>>\
Meanwhile, <<print $newkid>> pesters Peter with questions about himself and the other children, and about the Bogeyman and life in the hovel. When it comes time to boil the bones, you pray <<print $he>> won't ask where they came from.<<endif>>

[[WHEN IT GETS TOO DARK TO SEE, YOU LIGHT THE LAMP]]

links.text: WHEN IT GETS TOO DARK TO SEE, YOU LIGHT THE LAMP

destination.name: WHEN IT GETS TOO DARK TO SEE, YOU LIGHT THE LAMP

passages.name: WHEN IT GETS TOO DARK TO SEE, YOU LIGHT THE LAMP
passages.text:
Soon afterwards, the Bogeyman emerges from his room and takes his place at the head of the table. You take your usual place on his left. <<print $newkid>> takes the chair that used to <<if $survivor eq "Grace">>Humphrey's<<else>>Grace's<<endif>>.

[[NOBODY LOOKS AT TABITHA'S EMPTY CHAIR]]

links.text: NOBODY LOOKS AT TABITHA'S EMPTY CHAIR

destination.name: NOBODY LOOKS AT TABITHA'S EMPTY CHAIR

passages.name: NOBODY LOOKS AT TABITHA'S EMPTY CHAIR
passages.text:
{{{We are truly grateful for what we have.}}}

[[WE ARE TRULY GRATEFUL FOR WHAT WE HAVE|grateful]]

links.text: WE ARE TRULY GRATEFUL FOR WHAT WE HAVE

passages.name: grateful
passages.text:
After draining his second bowl of soup, the Bogeyman lays his hands flat on the table and addresses you: {{{Children.}}}

[[EVERYBODY SITS UP A LITTLE STRAIGHTER]]

links.text: EVERYBODY SITS UP A LITTLE STRAIGHTER

destination.name: EVERYBODY SITS UP A LITTLE STRAIGHTER

passages.name: EVERYBODY SITS UP A LITTLE STRAIGHTER
passages.text:
{{{As you may have noticed, our friend Tabitha left us last night. She tried to follow me to my work, failed, and now she's trying to survive on the mountainside with the meagre provisions she was able to steal beforehand.}}}

[[GLANCE AT THE RAIN STREAMING DOWN THE WINDOWS]]

links.text: GLANCE AT THE RAIN STREAMING DOWN THE WINDOWS

destination.name: GLANCE AT THE RAIN STREAMING DOWN THE WINDOWS

passages.name: GLANCE AT THE RAIN STREAMING DOWN THE WINDOWS
passages.text:
{{{I absolutely cannot be bothered to rescue her. She can come back in her own time, or she can die of starvation and exposure. Needless to say, if she does come back, she will be punished.}}}

<<if $newkid eq "Christopher">>[[CHRISTOPHER PIPES UP|pipe]]<<else>>[[JENNIFER PIPES UP|pipe]]<<endif>>

passages.name: pipe
passages.text:
<<print $survivor>> and Peter watch in horror as <<print $he>> raises <<print $his>> hand. "Sorry, sir, but I was just wondering, who's Tabitha?"

<<if $newkid eq "Christopher">>[[THE BOGEYMAN'S PALE EYES NARROW IN HIS DIRECTION|narrow]]<<else>>[[THE BOGEYMAN'S PALE EYES NARROW IN HER DIRECTION|narrow]]<<endif>>

links.text: THE BOGEYMAN'S PALE EYES NARROW IN HIS DIRECTION
THE BOGEYMAN'S PALE EYES NARROW IN HER DIRECTION

passages.name: narrow
passages.text:
{{{Speak when you're spoken to, you ugly little wretch.}}}

<<if $newkid eq "Christopher">>[[HE CLIPS CHRISTOPHER ROUND THE EAR|clip]]<<else>>[[HE CLIPS JENNIFER ROUND THE EAR|clip]]<<endif>>

links.text: HE CLIPS CHRISTOPHER ROUND THE EAR
HE CLIPS JENNIFER ROUND THE EAR

passages.name: clip
passages.text:
{{{Anyway. I just wanted to make it clear that this is not an excuse for the rest of you to slack off, nor will we be forgoing the roast this week.}}}

<<if $newkid eq "Christopher">>[[CHRISTOPHER IS NO LONGER LISTENING, BLINKING AWAY SHOCKED TEARS|blink]]<<else>>[[JENNIFER IS NO LONGER LISTENING, BLINKING AWAY SHOCKED TEARS|blink]]<<endif>>

links.text: CHRISTOPHER IS NO LONGER LISTENING, BLINKING AWAY SHOCKED TEARS
JENNIFER IS NO LONGER LISTENING, BLINKING AWAY SHOCKED TEARS

passages.name: blink
passages.text:
{{{If she's not back by Sunday, I'll assume she's dead and bring back two new kids to make up the numbers. In the meantime, I expect to see you all working as hard as you can to compensate for her absence. Understood?}}}

[[YES, SIR|sir]]

passages.name: sir
passages.text:
You rise, wash up, wipe down the table, and reconvene for bedtime milk. <<print $newkid>>'s disgust is obvious on <<print $his>> face. For a moment <<print $he>> looks like <<print $he>>'s going to say something.

[[THEN THINKS BETTER OF IT]]

passages.name: THEN THINKS BETTER OF IT
passages.text:
<<print $capitalHe>> goes limp in seconds, just like you did after your first glass.

<<if $newkid eq "Christopher">>[[YOU WRANGLE HIM UP THE STAIRS BEFORE YOUR OWN DOSE CAN KICK IN|wrangle]]<<else>>[[YOU WRANGLE HER UP THE STAIRS BEFORE YOUR OWN DOSE CAN KICK IN|wrangle]]<<endif>>

links.text: YOU WRANGLE HIM UP THE STAIRS BEFORE YOUR OWN DOSE CAN KICK IN
YOU WRANGLE HER UP THE STAIRS BEFORE YOUR OWN DOSE CAN KICK IN

passages.name: wrangle
passages.text:
Back in the bedroom at last, you deposit <> on <>Humphrey's<>Grace's<> old bed. <> whimpers. "'S cold. Can't. Don't."
<>[[GIVE HIM TABITHA'S BLANKETS|give]]<>[[GIVE HER TABITHA'S BLANKETS|give]]<> <>[[GO TO BED|sleep]]<>[[GO TO BED|sleep]]<>

passages.name: give
passages.text:
<<set $giveblankets = true>>With the last of your strength, you gather up the rags from Tabitha's empty bed and toss them on top of <<print $newkid>>, who rolls under the extra warmth and mumbles something grateful.

[[GO TO BED|bed2]]

passages.name: sleep
passages.text:
You leave <<print $newkid>> sinking into a fitful sleep and retreat to your own poor excuse for a bed.

[[UNCONSCIOUSNESS COMES EASILY NOW]]

passages.name: bed2
passages.text:
You leave <<print $newkid>> snoring and retreat to your own poor excuse for a bed.

[[UNCONSCIOUSNESS COMES EASILY NOW]]

passages.name: UNCONSCIOUSNESS COMES EASILY NOW
passages.text:
You dream the outline of Tabitha again, with her eyes shining in the dark.

[[AND WAKE UP]]

passages.name: AND WAKE UP
passages.text:
Tuesday blurs into Wednesday. The fog wraps thicker about the hovel.

[[YOU DO YOUR CHORES]]

passages.name: YOU DO YOUR CHORES
passages.text:
<<if $survivor eq "Grace">>Grace keeps sulking – maybe she misses Tabitha, or Humphrey, or both of them<<else>>Humphrey keeps sulking – maybe he misses Tabitha, or Grace, or both of them<<endif>>.

[[NOBODY SAYS ANYTHING]]

passages.name: NOBODY SAYS ANYTHING
passages.text:
<<if $giveblankets>><<print $newkid>> starts to settle in better after that first night under the influence. Tabitha won't mind that you gave away her bed, you think, to somebody who needed it.<<else>><<print $newkid>> continues to sleep badly, waking up in the mornings almost too stiff to move.<<endif>>

[[THINGS AREN'T TOO HARD WITH ONLY FOUR OF YOU]]

links.text: THINGS AREN'T TOO HARD WITH ONLY FOUR OF YOU

destination.name: THINGS AREN'T TOO HARD WITH ONLY FOUR OF YOU

passages.name: THINGS AREN'T TOO HARD WITH ONLY FOUR OF YOU
passages.text:
Many of the chores the Bogeyman dishes out are mere busywork anyway. He has you all polish your spades before and after pit duty, and rearrange the furniture in the kitchen only to put it back where it was.

[[AT LEAST IT'S QUIET]]

passages.name: AT LEAST IT'S QUIET
passages.text:
Once again, you find yourself singled out from the others to wait on him hand and foot. Spending hours in close quarters with him while he chews makes your skin feel sticky and greasy.

[[YOU LEARN TO READ HIS WANTS FROM SUBTLE CHANGES IN THE WAY HE SNAPS HIS FINGERS AT YOU]]

links.text: YOU LEARN TO READ HIS WANTS FROM SUBTLE CHANGES IN THE WAY HE SNAPS HIS FINGERS AT YOU

destination.name: YOU LEARN TO READ HIS WANTS FROM SUBTLE CHANGES IN THE WAY HE SNAPS HIS FINGERS AT YOU

passages.name: YOU LEARN TO READ HIS WANTS FROM SUBTLE CHANGES IN THE WAY HE SNAPS HIS FINGERS AT YOU
passages.text: On Thursday morning, a huge bathtub of chipped ceramic appears in the kitchen. [[YOUR HEART LEAPS AT THE PROSPECT OF A BATH]]

links.text: YOUR HEART LEAPS AT THE PROSPECT OF A BATH

destination.name: YOUR HEART LEAPS AT THE PROSPECT OF A BATH

passages.name: YOUR HEART LEAPS AT THE PROSPECT OF A BATH
passages.text:
No such luck. You get to fetch the water, and heat the water, and the Bogeyman gets to take the bath.

[[AT LEAST YOU DON'T HAVE TO GO BAREFOOT ANYMORE]]

links.text: AT LEAST YOU DON'T HAVE TO GO BAREFOOT ANYMORE

destination.name: AT LEAST YOU DON'T HAVE TO GO BAREFOOT ANYMORE

passages.name: AT LEAST YOU DON'T HAVE TO GO BAREFOOT ANYMORE
passages.text:
You're making your second trip back from the stream, loaded down with a bucket in each hand, when you spot movement behind the woodshed.

[[IT'S PETER, BENDING FURTIVELY OVER SOMETHING ON THE GROUND]]

links.text: IT'S PETER, BENDING FURTIVELY OVER SOMETHING ON THE GROUND

destination.name: IT'S PETER, BENDING FURTIVELY OVER SOMETHING ON THE GROUND

passages.name: IT'S PETER, BENDING FURTIVELY OVER SOMETHING ON THE GROUND
passages.text:
As you pass, he looks up guiltily and flattens himself against the wall.
[[APPROACH HIM]] [[LEAVE HIM TO IT]]

passages.name: APPROACH HIM
passages.text:
<<set $knowpeter = true>>You totter over, doing your best not to spill your buckets.

[[HE GLANCES AROUND NERVOUSLY]]

passages.name: LEAVE HIM TO IT
passages.text:
You leave him to his secret errand and hurry back to the hovel. You've got a job to do, after all.

[[PETER'S EYES FOLLOW YOU ANXIOUSLY AS YOU PASS|YOU HURRY BACK TO THE HOVEL BEFORE THE BOGEYMAN STARTS WONDERING WHERE YOU'VE GOT TO]]

links.text: PETER'S EYES FOLLOW YOU ANXIOUSLY AS YOU PASS

destination.name: YOU HURRY BACK TO THE HOVEL BEFORE THE BOGEYMAN STARTS WONDERING WHERE YOU'VE GOT TO

passages.name: HE GLANCES AROUND NERVOUSLY
passages.text:
Now you can see what he was doing: there's a small depression in the ground by the wall of the woodshed, normally sheltered by rocks. He's cleared a little space and packed it with a small parcel.

[[SOMETHING WRAPPED IN A SCRAP OF CLOTH]]

links.text: SOMETHING WRAPPED IN A SCRAP OF CLOTH

destination.name: SOMETHING WRAPPED IN A SCRAP OF CLOTH

passages.name: SOMETHING WRAPPED IN A SCRAP OF CLOTH
passages.text:
"Bread," he admits, without meeting your eye. "Just a little. For Tabitha."

[[HE QUICKLY SHOVES THE ROCKS BACK INTO PLACE]]

links.text: HE QUICKLY SHOVES THE ROCKS BACK INTO PLACE

destination.name: HE QUICKLY SHOVES THE ROCKS BACK INTO PLACE

passages.name: HE QUICKLY SHOVES THE ROCKS BACK INTO PLACE
passages.text:
"You won't tell him, will you? Promise you won't."
[[I PROMISE]] [[I CAN'T PROMISE THAT]]

passages.name: I PROMISE
passages.text:
His shoulders slump in relief. "Thank you. Thank you. I knew I could trust you."

[[YOU HURRY BACK TO THE HOVEL BEFORE THE BOGEYMAN STARTS WONDERING WHERE YOU'VE GOT TO]]

links.text: YOU HURRY BACK TO THE HOVEL BEFORE THE BOGEYMAN STARTS WONDERING WHERE YOU'VE GOT TO

destination.name: YOU HURRY BACK TO THE HOVEL BEFORE THE BOGEYMAN STARTS WONDERING WHERE YOU'VE GOT TO

passages.name: I CAN'T PROMISE THAT
passages.text:
<<set $nopromise = true>>He goes pale, but he nods at you before sinking down against the wall of the woodshed, clutching his head in his hands.

[[YOU HURRY BACK TO THE HOVEL BEFORE THE BOGEYMAN STARTS WONDERING WHERE YOU'VE GOT TO]]

links.text: YOU HURRY BACK TO THE HOVEL BEFORE THE BOGEYMAN STARTS WONDERING WHERE YOU'VE GOT TO

destination.name: YOU HURRY BACK TO THE HOVEL BEFORE THE BOGEYMAN STARTS WONDERING WHERE YOU'VE GOT TO

passages.name: YOU HURRY BACK TO THE HOVEL BEFORE THE BOGEYMAN STARTS WONDERING WHERE YOU'VE GOT TO
passages.text:
Back in the kitchen, you set your buckets down on the table. More water is already warming on the hob while the bathtub stands, empty and waiting, on its clawed iron feet.

[[THE BOGEYMAN GLANCES OVER AT YOU FROM HIS CHAIR]]

links.text: THE BOGEYMAN GLANCES OVER AT YOU FROM HIS CHAIR

destination.name: THE BOGEYMAN GLANCES OVER AT YOU FROM HIS CHAIR

passages.name: THE BOGEYMAN GLANCES OVER AT YOU FROM HIS CHAIR
passages.text:
{{{Did you see Peter just now?}}} he asks, still chewing a lump of black stuff. {{{I sent him to get some more wood from the shed ten minutes ago, and I haven't seen a sign of the shiftless little good-for-nothing since.}}}

[[HE SOUNDS TOO CASUAL]]

passages.name: HE SOUNDS TOO CASUAL
passages.text:
He raises an eyebrow at your silence. {{{Well?}}}
[[YES, I SAW HIM]] [[NO, I DIDN'T SEE HIM]]

passages.name: YES, I SAW HIM
passages.text:
{{{Yes? And what was he up to? Was he fetching wood?}}}
[[YES, HE WAS FETCHING WOOD|NO, I DIDN'T SEE HIM]] [[NO, I DON'T THINK HE WAS]]

links.text: NO, I DON'T THINK HE WAS

destination.name: NO, I DON'T THINK HE WAS

passages.name: NO, I DIDN'T SEE HIM
passages.text:
{{{Really.}}} The eyebrow comes down again into a frown. {{{Alright then.}}}

[[HIS CHEWING FILLS THE KITCHEN AS YOU GET BACK TO WORK]]

links.text: HIS CHEWING FILLS THE KITCHEN AS YOU GET BACK TO WORK

destination.name: HIS CHEWING FILLS THE KITCHEN AS YOU GET BACK TO WORK

passages.name: HIS CHEWING FILLS THE KITCHEN AS YOU GET BACK TO WORK
passages.text:
When the water on the stove starts to bubble, you pour it out into the tub. It makes a hollow noise as it slaps against the sides.

[[YOU REFILL THE POT AND PUT IT BACK ON THE HEAT|heat]]

links.text: YOU REFILL THE POT AND PUT IT BACK ON THE HEAT

passages.name: NO, I DON'T THINK HE WAS
passages.text:
<<set $snitch = true>>The eyebrow comes down again into a frown. {{{I see.}}}

[[HE SPITS HIS LUMP OF BLACK STUFF OUT ONTO THE TABLE]]

links.text: HE SPITS HIS LUMP OF BLACK STUFF OUT ONTO THE TABLE

destination.name: HE SPITS HIS LUMP OF BLACK STUFF OUT ONTO THE TABLE

passages.name: HE SPITS HIS LUMP OF BLACK STUFF OUT ONTO THE TABLE
passages.text:
He stands, letting his chair scrape on the floor, and strides over to the door. {{{Wait here and keep getting my bath ready,}}} he orders, before disappearing outside.

[[YOU WAIT]]

passages.name: YOU WAIT
passages.text:
When the water on the stove starts to bubble, you pour it out into the tub. It makes a hollow noise as it slaps against the sides.

[[YOU REFILL THE POT AND PUT IT BACK ON THE HEAT]]

links.text: YOU REFILL THE POT AND PUT IT BACK ON THE HEAT

destination.name: YOU REFILL THE POT AND PUT IT BACK ON THE HEAT

passages.name: YOU REFILL THE POT AND PUT IT BACK ON THE HEAT
passages.text:
After a few minutes, the Bogeyman returns.

[[HE HAS A LUMP OF BREAD IN ONE HAND AND PETER DANGLING LIKE A DOLL FROM THE OTHER]]

links.text: HE HAS A LUMP OF BREAD IN ONE HAND AND PETER DANGLING LIKE A DOLL FROM THE OTHER

destination.name: HE HAS A LUMP OF BREAD IN ONE HAND AND PETER DANGLING LIKE A DOLL FROM THE OTHER

passages.name: HE HAS A LUMP OF BREAD IN ONE HAND AND PETER DANGLING LIKE A DOLL FROM THE OTHER
passages.text:
{{{Leaving food out for the rats,}}} he spits. {{{For one particular rat.}}}

[[HE SWALLOWS THE BREAD IN TWO BITES]]

links.text: HE SWALLOWS THE BREAD IN TWO BITES

destination.name: HE SWALLOWS THE BREAD IN TWO BITES

passages.name: HE SWALLOWS THE BREAD IN TWO BITES
passages.text:
<<if $nopromise>>Peter avoids your eyes<<else>>Peter stares at you with betrayal in his eyes<<endif>> as the Bogeyman drags him over to the kitchen cupboards.

[[HE DOESN'T STRUGGLE]]

passages.name: HE DOESN'T STRUGGLE
passages.text:
{{{Can't keep your greedy little hands out of my cupboards? Fine.}}} The Bogeyman opens one of the larger cupboards and sweeps everything out of it onto the floor.

[[HE SHOVES PETER INSIDE]]

passages.name: HE SHOVES PETER INSIDE
passages.text:
{{{You'd better pray for your precious Tabitha to come crawling back before Sunday. Because if it's not her in that oven, it's going to be you.}}}

[[HE BANGS THE CUPBOARD SHUT AND JAMS THE DOOR WITH PETER'S CHAIR]]

links.text: HE BANGS THE CUPBOARD SHUT AND JAMS THE DOOR WITH PETER'S CHAIR

destination.name: HE BANGS THE CUPBOARD SHUT AND JAMS THE DOOR WITH PETER'S CHAIR

passages.name: HE BANGS THE CUPBOARD SHUT AND JAMS THE DOOR WITH PETER'S CHAIR
passages.text:
The Bogeyman turns around to face you. He snaps his fingers for you to tidy up the kitchenware scattered about his feet.

[[YOU SCRAMBLE TO FIND NEW PLACES TO PUT IT ALL WHILE HE GOES BACK TO HIS CHAIR]]

links.text: YOU SCRAMBLE TO FIND NEW PLACES TO PUT IT ALL WHILE HE GOES BACK TO HIS CHAIR

destination.name: YOU SCRAMBLE TO FIND NEW PLACES TO PUT IT ALL WHILE HE GOES BACK TO HIS CHAIR

passages.name: YOU SCRAMBLE TO FIND NEW PLACES TO PUT IT ALL WHILE HE GOES BACK TO HIS CHAIR
passages.text:
He picks up the black lump off the table, puts it back in his mouth, and starts chewing again.

[[YOU TURN BACK TO THE STOVE]]

links.text: YOU TURN BACK TO THE STOVE

destination.name: YOU TURN BACK TO THE STOVE

passages.name: YOU TURN BACK TO THE STOVE
passages.text:
Eventually, you manage to fill the tub to a level and temperature he finds adequate. As far as you're concerned, the water is scalding, but you would almost risk it against your skin for a chance to feel clean.

[[HE DOESN'T EVEN FLINCH AT THE HEAT]]

links.text: HE DOESN'T EVEN FLINCH AT THE HEAT

destination.name: HE DOESN'T EVEN FLINCH AT THE HEAT

passages.name: HE DOESN'T EVEN FLINCH AT THE HEAT
passages.text:
The water turns a cloudy white when it touches his skin. He shudders happily as steam rises around him.

[[FETCH A RAG FROM THE SINK]]

links.text: FETCH A RAG FROM THE SINK

destination.name: FETCH A RAG FROM THE SINK

passages.name: heat
passages.text:
After a few minutes, Peter struggles through the door with a double armful of firewood.

[[THE BOGEYMAN GROWLS]]

passages.name: THE BOGEYMAN GROWLS
passages.text:
{{{You took your time.}}}

[[PETER CRINGES]]

passages.name: PETER CRINGES
passages.text:
"I just, you know. I wanted to make sure I got enough, sir."

[[YOU HELP HIM WITH STACKING THE WOOD BESIDE THE OVEN|THEN THE BOGEYMAN SPEAKS UP AGAIN]]

links.text: YOU HELP HIM WITH STACKING THE WOOD BESIDE THE OVEN

destination.name: THEN THE BOGEYMAN SPEAKS UP AGAIN

passages.name: THEN THE BOGEYMAN SPEAKS UP AGAIN
passages.text:
{{{We seem to be running a bit low on bread.}}} That too-casual tone again. {{{Neither of you would happen to know anything about that, would you?}}}

[[PETER GLANCES FEARFULLY AT YOU]]

passages.name: PETER GLANCES FEARFULLY AT YOU
passages.text:
"No," he says. "No, sir. No idea, sir."

[[THERE'S SILENCE FOR A MOMENT BEFORE THE BOGEYMAN STARTS CHEWING AGAIN]]

links.text: THERE'S SILENCE FOR A MOMENT BEFORE THE BOGEYMAN STARTS CHEWING AGAIN

destination.name: THERE'S SILENCE FOR A MOMENT BEFORE THE BOGEYMAN STARTS CHEWING AGAIN

passages.name: THERE'S SILENCE FOR A MOMENT BEFORE THE BOGEYMAN STARTS CHEWING AGAIN
passages.text:
{{{Must have been rats. Well, never mind. The fatter they are, the better eats they'll make when we catch them, hmm?}}}

[[A SHUDDER RUNS BETWEEN YOU]]

passages.name: A SHUDDER RUNS BETWEEN YOU
passages.text:
When the firewood has been stacked, the Bogeyman dismisses Peter to another errand outside. Peter goes as fast as his legs will carry him.

[[LEAVING YOU ALONE WITH THE BATH AND THE BOGEYMAN|YOU TURN BACK TO THE STOVE]]

links.text: LEAVING YOU ALONE WITH THE BATH AND THE BOGEYMAN

destination.name: YOU TURN BACK TO THE STOVE

passages.name: FETCH A RAG FROM THE SINK
passages.text:
Try as you might not to look at him while you scrub his back, you can't help noticing the scars covering his arms and neck. Some of them look fresh.
[[ASK ABOUT THEM|ASK ABOUT THE SCARS]] [[KEEP QUIET]]

passages.name: ASK ABOUT THE SCARS
passages.text:
{{{Brats have been known to scratch. You have to admire them for trying. Stay focused, now.}}}
[[SCRUB HARDER]] [[SCRUB SOFTER]]

passages.name: KEEP QUIET
passages.text:
You stare at the rag in your hands as it strips the grime out of him, trying to stay focused.
[[SCRUB HARDER]] [[SCRUB SOFTER]]

passages.name: SCRUB HARDER
passages.text:
{{{Trying to flay me alive, fish? Ease up or I'll flay you.}}}

[[SCRUB SOFTER|scrub]]

passages.name: SCRUB SOFTER
passages.text:
{{{Put your back into it, fish, for god's sake.}}}

[[SCRUB HARDER|scrub]]

passages.name: scrub
passages.text:
You can't see his face, but you hear his voice soften. <<if $snitch>>{{{Thank you for being honest with me about Peter. I know I'm not always the best at showing it, but I appreciate having someone around that I can rely on.}}}<<else>>{{{I'd like to think I could trust you, fish. Peter is one thing, but I've been hoping you'd turn out to be a good kid.}}}<<endif>>

[[YOU DON'T HEAR SO MUCH AS FEEL THE SIGH HE MAKES]]

links.text: YOU DON'T HEAR SO MUCH AS FEEL THE SIGH HE MAKES

destination.name: YOU DON'T HEAR SO MUCH AS FEEL THE SIGH HE MAKES

passages.name: YOU DON'T HEAR SO MUCH AS FEEL THE SIGH HE MAKES
passages.text:
{{{Tabitha thought she was the reliable one, but she was a demon. She only got worse with time. Hoarding matches, staying up past bedtime. Harbouring dirty thoughts.}}}
[[WHY DIDN'T YOU EAT HER]] [[WHY DIDN'T YOU LET HER GO HOME]]

links.text: WHY DIDN'T YOU LET HER GO HOME

destination.name: WHY DIDN'T YOU LET HER GO HOME

passages.name: WHY DIDN'T YOU EAT HER
passages.text:
He snorts. {{{Force of habit, I suppose. She was here so long. It would have been like eating a family pet.}}}

[[HE STRETCHES AND LEANS BACK]]

passages.name: WHY DIDN'T YOU LET HER GO HOME
passages.text:
He snorts. {{{Force of habit, I suppose. She was here so long. It would have been like throwing out a piece of the furniture.}}}

[[HE STRETCHES AND LEANS BACK]]

passages.name: HE STRETCHES AND LEANS BACK
passages.text:
You move down to the other end of the tub to scrub his feet.

[[TRY NOT TO CUT YOURSELF ON HIS SLAB YELLOW TOENAILS]]

links.text: TRY NOT TO CUT YOURSELF ON HIS SLAB YELLOW TOENAILS

destination.name: TRY NOT TO CUT YOURSELF ON HIS SLAB YELLOW TOENAILS

passages.name: TRY NOT TO CUT YOURSELF ON HIS SLAB YELLOW TOENAILS
passages.text:
{{{I wouldn't mind so much if she was just gone. It's the thought that she's still corrupting the rest of you with her stupidity. What really bothered me about her was how stupid she was.}}}

[[YOU CAN SEE HIS FACE NOW AND HE DOESN'T LOOK ANGRY]]

links.text: YOU CAN SEE HIS FACE NOW AND HE DOESN'T LOOK ANGRY

destination.name: YOU CAN SEE HIS FACE NOW AND HE DOESN'T LOOK ANGRY

passages.name: YOU CAN SEE HIS FACE NOW AND HE DOESN'T LOOK ANGRY
passages.text:
{{{She wanted to get out so badly that she never even considered doing things the simple way. You know you can go home any time, right? It's easy.}}}

[[IS IT]]

passages.name: IS IT
passages.text:
{{{Sure it is, fish. You've just got to be good, that's all. No tricks, no secrets. You can go home when you learn to be good.}}}
[[I'M ALREADY GOOD ENOUGH]] [[I'LL TRY TO BE BETTER]]

passages.name: I'M ALREADY GOOD ENOUGH
passages.text:
<<if $snitch>>He grins and nudges you with a toe. {{{After today, I'd say you're certainly getting there.}}}<<else>>He looks at you, suddenly severe. {{{You're good enough when I say you're good enough, child. And I say you still have a ways to go. Good children don't keep secrets, you know.}}}<<endif>>

[[HE PULLS BACK HIS FEET AND SITS UP]]

links.text: HE PULLS BACK HIS FEET AND SITS UP

destination.name: HE PULLS BACK HIS FEET AND SITS UP

passages.name: I'LL TRY TO BE BETTER
passages.text:
<<if $snitch>>He grins and nudges you with a toe. {{{After today, I'd say you're already doing pretty well.}}}<<else>>He looks at you, suddenly severe. {{{Yes, you will. You still have a long way to go, child. Good children don't keep secrets, you know.}}}<<endif>>

[[HE PULLS BACK HIS FEET AND SITS UP]]

links.text: HE PULLS BACK HIS FEET AND SITS UP

destination.name: HE PULLS BACK HIS FEET AND SITS UP

passages.name: HE PULLS BACK HIS FEET AND SITS UP
passages.text:
The water is opaque now, and crusted with foam.

[[AFTER DRAINING THE TUB, IT TAKES YOU THE REST OF THE MORNING TO SCRUB IT ANYWHERE NEAR CLEAN]]

links.text: AFTER DRAINING THE TUB, IT TAKES YOU THE REST OF THE MORNING TO SCRUB IT ANYWHERE NEAR CLEAN

destination.name: AFTER DRAINING THE TUB, IT TAKES YOU THE REST OF THE MORNING TO SCRUB IT ANYWHERE NEAR CLEAN

passages.name: AFTER DRAINING THE TUB, IT TAKES YOU THE REST OF THE MORNING TO SCRUB IT ANYWHERE NEAR CLEAN
passages.text:
<<if $snitch>>You don't hear a sound from Peter's cupboard for the rest of the day, but you're sure he hears everything that passes in the kitchen.

[[THE BOGEYMAN LETS HIM OUT FOR DINNER|milk]]\
<<else>>\
You don't see Peter again until dinner.

[[EVEN THEN HE AVOIDS YOUR EYES|milk]]<<endif>>

links.text: THE BOGEYMAN LETS HIM OUT FOR DINNER
EVEN THEN HE AVOIDS YOUR EYES

passages.name: milk
passages.text:
<<print $survivor>> and <<print $newkid>> are equally subdued as they pick at their plates. <<print $newkid>> in particular looks nothing like the bubbly little <<if $boy>>boy<<else>>girl<<endif>> you met just a few days ago.

[[EVEN THE BOGEYMAN DOESN'T SEEM TO BE ENJOYING HIS FOOD MUCH]]

links.text: EVEN THE BOGEYMAN DOESN'T SEEM TO BE ENJOYING HIS FOOD MUCH

destination.name: EVEN THE BOGEYMAN DOESN'T SEEM TO BE ENJOYING HIS FOOD MUCH

passages.name: EVEN THE BOGEYMAN DOESN'T SEEM TO BE ENJOYING HIS FOOD MUCH
passages.text:
Before pouring everyone's bedtime milk, he draws you all to attention for another little speech.

[[YOU RECOGNISE THE IRRITATION IN HIS VOICE]]

links.text: YOU RECOGNISE THE IRRITATION IN HIS VOICE

destination.name: YOU RECOGNISE THE IRRITATION IN HIS VOICE

passages.name: YOU RECOGNISE THE IRRITATION IN HIS VOICE
passages.text:
{{{Just to remind you all – Tabitha ran away of her own accord. If she wants to be fed and sheltered like the rest of you, she's welcome to come back any time.}}}

[[HE GLARES AT PETER, WHO KEEPS HIS GAZE LOWERED]]

links.text: HE GLARES AT PETER, WHO KEEPS HIS GAZE LOWERED

destination.name: HE GLARES AT PETER, WHO KEEPS HIS GAZE LOWERED

passages.name: HE GLARES AT PETER, WHO KEEPS HIS GAZE LOWERED
passages.text: {{{If she attempts to communicate with any of you, or if you think someone else might be in collusion with her, I expect you to come to me immediately.}}} ![[IMMEDIATELY|IMMEDIATELY]]

passages.name: IMMEDIATELY
passages.text:
{{{Do I make myself clear?}}}

[[YES, SIR|yes]]

passages.name: yes
passages.text:
This time, you barely notice the milk going down. You don't even feel it tugging at your brain until you're upstairs in the bedroom, and even then,

[[THE SLEEP THAT TAKES YOU IS NOT THE DEEP AND DREAMLESS ONE YOU'RE USED TO]]

links.text: THE SLEEP THAT TAKES YOU IS NOT THE DEEP AND DREAMLESS ONE YOU'RE USED TO

destination.name: THE SLEEP THAT TAKES YOU IS NOT THE DEEP AND DREAMLESS ONE YOU'RE USED TO

passages.name: THE SLEEP THAT TAKES YOU IS NOT THE DEEP AND DREAMLESS ONE YOU'RE USED TO
passages.text: <<goto "chapter5">>

passages.name: chapter5
passages.text:
You dream about lying in your room at home. Monsters in the closet, monsters under the bed.

[[AND WAKE WITH THE SMELL OF SOMETHING BURNING|ch5]]

links.text: AND WAKE WITH THE SMELL OF SOMETHING BURNING

passages.name: AND WAKE WITH THE SMELL OF SOMETHING BURNING
passages.text:
Too hot. You've //never// been hot in this room.

[[THROW THE BLANKETS OFF]]

passages.name: THROW THE BLANKETS OFF
passages.text:
The bedroom looks more or less as it should, but something's wrong. Maybe it's the moonlight.
[[THE DOOR|firedoor]] [[THE WINDOW|firewindow]]
[[THE BEDS|firebeds]] [[THE CHILDREN|firechildren]]

passages.name: ch1
passages.text: <><> <>CHAPTER ONE<> <>[[BROTH|THE DOOR SLAMS BEHIND HIM]]<>

passages.name: ch4
passages.text:
You're woken suddenly by a thump that shakes the floor.

[[THE FRONT DOOR SLAMMING]]

passages.name: ch5title
passages.text: <

destination.name: AND WAKE WITH THE SMELL OF SOMETHING BURNING

passages.name: firewindow
passages.text:
Pressing your nose to the window, you can see orange light spilling up the mountainside and into the black ice sky.

<<if $windowunlocked>>[[WARPED BY THE THICK GLASS, IT LOOKS LIKE A RIVER OF GINGER HAIR|AND THERE'S THAT SMELL AGAIN]]<<else>><<if $firecomb>>[[WARPED BY THE THICK GLASS, IT LOOKS LIKE A RIVER OF GINGER HAIR]]<<else>>[[WARPED BY THE THICK GLASS, IT LOOKS LIKE A RIVER OF GINGER HAIR|THROW THE BLANKETS OFF]]<<endif>><<endif>>

links.text: WARPED BY THE THICK GLASS, IT LOOKS LIKE A RIVER OF GINGER HAIR
WARPED BY THE THICK GLASS, IT LOOKS LIKE A RIVER OF GINGER HAIR

destination.name: WARPED BY THE THICK GLASS, IT LOOKS LIKE A RIVER OF GINGER HAIR

links.text: WARPED BY THE THICK GLASS, IT LOOKS LIKE A RIVER OF GINGER HAIR

passages.name: firedoor
passages.text:
The door swings open and you step out onto the landing. It's cooler here.
[[YOUR ROOM]] [[HIS ROOM]]
[[THE STAIRS]]

passages.name: YOUR ROOM
passages.text:
You step back into the communal bedroom. It looks more or less as it should, but something's wrong. Maybe it's the moonlight.
[[THE DOOR|firedoor]] [[THE WINDOW|firewindow]]
[[THE BEDS|firebeds]] [[THE CHILDREN|firechildren]]

passages.name: HIS ROOM
passages.text:
You creep along the passage to the Bogeyman's bedroom and try the door. It's not locked.
[[GO INSIDE]] [[TURN BACK|landing]]

passages.name: THE STAIRS
passages.text:
Down the stairs and into the kitchen. Everything is in its place, except the pale shape of the bathtub still lurking in a corner.
[[THE WINDOWS|fire kitchen windows]] [[THE DOOR|fire kitchen door]]
[[THE STAIRS|firestairs]]

passages.name: firebeds
passages.text:
<>Your rags lie in a heap where you left them. [[THERE'S NOTHING UNDERNEATH BUT THE FLOORBOARDS|THROW THE BLANKETS OFF]]<>Among your discarded rags, you find Claire's comb. It's now missing all but one of its teeth.
[[TAKE IT]] [[LEAVE IT|THROW THE BLANKETS OFF]]
<>

links.text: THERE'S NOTHING UNDERNEATH BUT THE FLOORBOARDS

passages.name: firechildren
passages.text:
<<print $survivor>> and Peter are curled in opposite corners. <<if $giveblankets>><<print $newkid>>, round face shining with sweat, has pushed aside the extra blankets in <<print $his>> sleep.<<else>><<print $newkid>> usually shivers in <<print $his>> sleep all night, but now <<print $his>> round face is shining with sweat.<<endif>>

[[ALL OF THEM ARE DEEP UNDER THE INFLUENCE|THROW THE BLANKETS OFF]]

links.text: ALL OF THEM ARE DEEP UNDER THE INFLUENCE

passages.name: GO INSIDE
passages.text:
<<set $breakout = false>>Your eyes are useless against the dark in here. You have nothing to go on but the floor against your feet (sticky), the air against your bare arms (cold), and of course the smell (unmentionable).

[[YOU FEEL YOUR WAY FORWARD]]

passages.name: landing
passages.text:
You dither on the landing. It's cooler here.
[[YOUR ROOM]] [[HIS ROOM]]
[[THE STAIRS]]

passages.name: YOU FEEL YOUR WAY FORWARD
passages.text:
Until you bump into something that might be a bed.

[[THAT'S WHEN YOU SEE TWO PALE SPOTS OF LIGHT GLEAMING AT YOU]]

links.text: THAT'S WHEN YOU SEE TWO PALE SPOTS OF LIGHT GLEAMING AT YOU

destination.name: THAT'S WHEN YOU SEE TWO PALE SPOTS OF LIGHT GLEAMING AT YOU

passages.name: THAT'S WHEN YOU SEE TWO PALE SPOTS OF LIGHT GLEAMING AT YOU
passages.text:
{{{Hello.}}}

[[THERE'S A SNAP AND A HISS]]

links.text: THERE'S A SNAP AND A HISS

destination.name: THERE'S A SNAP AND A HISS

passages.name: THERE'S A SNAP AND A HISS
passages.text:
A lamp flares, then settles into a steady glow. You see the Bogeyman sitting up in his bed – a proper bed, with sheets and pillows. You see the stacks of books against the walls, the biscuit jar and the tin of black chewing-stuff on the bedside table.

[[YOU TAKE A MOMENT TO PROCESS THE FACT THAT HE'S HAD SECRET BISCUITS THIS WHOLE TIME]]

links.text: YOU TAKE A MOMENT TO PROCESS THE FACT THAT HE'S HAD SECRET BISCUITS THIS WHOLE TIME

destination.name: YOU TAKE A MOMENT TO PROCESS THE FACT THAT HE'S HAD SECRET BISCUITS THIS WHOLE TIME

passages.name: YOU TAKE A MOMENT TO PROCESS THE FACT THAT HE'S HAD SECRET BISCUITS THIS WHOLE TIME
passages.text:
{{{What is it, fish? Is she back?}}}
[[I THINK SO|getup]] [[NO, BUT SOMETHING'S WRONG|getup]]

passages.name: getup
passages.text:
He swings his legs out of the bed and stands up. He's already wearing his boots. {{{Cloak,}}} he barks.

[[FETCH IT FROM A HOOK BEHIND THE DOOR]]

links.text: FETCH IT FROM A HOOK BEHIND THE DOOR

destination.name: FETCH IT FROM A HOOK BEHIND THE DOOR

passages.name: FETCH IT FROM A HOOK BEHIND THE DOOR
passages.text:
He shrugs it on and becomes that familiar tower of folded darkness.

[[HE SWEEPS OUT OF THE ROOM WITH A GESTURE FOR YOU TO FOLLOW]]

links.text: HE SWEEPS OUT OF THE ROOM WITH A GESTURE FOR YOU TO FOLLOW

destination.name: HE SWEEPS OUT OF THE ROOM WITH A GESTURE FOR YOU TO FOLLOW

passages.name: HE SWEEPS OUT OF THE ROOM WITH A GESTURE FOR YOU TO FOLLOW
passages.text:
You hurry after him, down the stairs and into the kitchen, where orange light is pooling beneath the windows.

[[HE TAKES OUT HIS KEY AND OPENS THE FRONT DOOR]]

links.text: HE TAKES OUT HIS KEY AND OPENS THE FRONT DOOR
