destination.name: HE TAKES OUT HIS KEY AND OPENS THE FRONT DOOR

passages.name: TAKE IT
passages.text:
<<set $firecomb = true>>It's warm to the touch.

[[SLIP IT IN YOUR POCKET|THROW THE BLANKETS OFF]]

passages.name: WARPED BY THE THICK GLASS, IT LOOKS LIKE A RIVER OF GINGER HAIR
passages.text:
Claire's comb is back in your hand, catching the light in its faded flowers.
[[USE IT]] [[PUT IT AWAY|THROW THE BLANKETS OFF]]

passages.name: fire kitchen windows
passages.text:
They're sealed shut. Outside, an orange glow tugs at the edges of the sky – warmer than moonlight, stranger than sunlight.
THE WINDOWS [[THE DOOR|fire kitchen door]]
[[THE STAIRS|firestairs]]

passages.name: fire kitchen door
passages.text:
It's locked. Its fat iron hinges are warm under your fingers.
[[THE WINDOWS|fire kitchen windows]] THE DOOR
[[THE STAIRS|firestairs]]

passages.name: firestairs
passages.text:
You leave the kitchen and climb back up to the landing. It's cooler here.
[[YOUR ROOM]] [[HIS ROOM]]
[[THE STAIRS]]

passages.name: USE IT
passages.text:
<<set $breakout = true>>Its last tooth slots into the keyhole.

[[PUSH UNTIL YOU HEAR A CLICK]]

links.text: PUSH UNTIL YOU HEAR A CLICK

destination.name: PUSH UNTIL YOU HEAR A CLICK

passages.name: PUSH UNTIL YOU HEAR A CLICK
passages.text:
The window swings open. The air that sweeps in is surprisingly warm.

[[AND THERE'S THAT SMELL AGAIN]]

passages.name: CLIMB OUT
passages.text:
The only way you can get out is by climbing up on the frame and lowering yourself through, feet-first.

[[THE OUTER WALL OF THE HOVEL IS CRUMBLING AND TREACHEROUS]]

links.text: THE OUTER WALL OF THE HOVEL IS CRUMBLING AND TREACHEROUS

destination.name: THE OUTER WALL OF THE HOVEL IS CRUMBLING AND TREACHEROUS

passages.name: THE OUTER WALL OF THE HOVEL IS CRUMBLING AND TREACHEROUS
passages.text:
There's no shortage of handholds, but you have to take care not to slip or splinter yourself too badly. It would be torture without the protection of your too-big shoes from the loft.

[[EVENTUALLY YOU FEEL DIRT BENEATH YOUR FEET]]

links.text: EVENTUALLY YOU FEEL DIRT BENEATH YOUR FEET

destination.name: EVENTUALLY YOU FEEL DIRT BENEATH YOUR FEET

passages.name: EVENTUALLY YOU FEEL DIRT BENEATH YOUR FEET
passages.text:
Following the light, you round the side of the hovel. With every step, the smell and the warm wind press stronger on your senses.

[[AND THEN YOU SEE THE WOODSHED]]

links.text: AND THEN YOU SEE THE WOODSHED

destination.name: AND THEN YOU SEE THE WOODSHED

passages.name: AND THEN YOU SEE THE WOODSHED
passages.text:
The tower of flames and smoke that used to be the woodshed. It looks strangely peaceful, somehow – so stark and brilliant against the night.

[[IT DRAWS YOU CLOSER]]

passages.name: IT DRAWS YOU CLOSER
passages.text:
The heat starts to prickle along your hairline as scraps of ash float down around you.

[[A SCRAWNY SILHOUETTE STANDS OUT AGAINST THE FLAMES]]

links.text: A SCRAWNY SILHOUETTE STANDS OUT AGAINST THE FLAMES

destination.name: A SCRAWNY SILHOUETTE STANDS OUT AGAINST THE FLAMES

passages.name: HE TAKES OUT HIS KEY AND OPENS THE FRONT DOOR
passages.text:
The air outside is surprisingly warm.

[[AND THERE'S THAT SMELL AGAIN|smell]]

passages.name: smell
passages.text:
The Bogeyman glances down to make sure you're still there. He nods approvingly, but his face is grim as he strides off around the side of the hovel.

[[SCURRY AFTER HIM]]

passages.name: SCURRY AFTER HIM
passages.text:
You round the corner too fast and bump into the back of his legs. He doesn't react. Peering around from behind his robes, you see it:

[[THE WOODSHED]]

passages.name: THE WOODSHED
passages.text:
The tower of flames and smoke that used to be the woodshed. It looks strangely peaceful, somehow – so stark and brilliant against the night.

[[THE TWO OF YOU PRESS CLOSER TO THE BLAZE]]

links.text: THE TWO OF YOU PRESS CLOSER TO THE BLAZE

destination.name: THE TWO OF YOU PRESS CLOSER TO THE BLAZE

passages.name: THE TWO OF YOU PRESS CLOSER TO THE BLAZE
passages.text:
The heat starts to prickle along your hairline as scraps of ash float down around you.

[[A SCRAWNY SILHOUETTE STANDS OUT AGAINST THE FLAMES|silhouette]]

links.text: A SCRAWNY SILHOUETTE STANDS OUT AGAINST THE FLAMES

passages.name: A SCRAWNY SILHOUETTE STANDS OUT AGAINST THE FLAMES
passages.text:
She has her back to you, gazing up at the fire. You draw closer until she turns.

[[HER HAIR STREAMS AROUND HER]]

passages.name: silhouette
passages.text:
She has her back to you, gazing up at the fire. You draw closer until she turns.

[[HER HAIR STREAMS AROUND HER|hair]]

passages.name: A COLD HAND APPEARS ON YOUR SHOULDER
passages.text:
You look up. The Bogeyman frowns back down at you. {{{I'm very disappointed in you, fish. You're lucky I have bigger issues to deal with right now.}}}

[[HE PUSHES PAST YOU TOWARDS THE BLAZE]]

links.text: HE PUSHES PAST YOU TOWARDS THE BLAZE

destination.name: HE PUSHES PAST YOU TOWARDS THE BLAZE

passages.name: HE PUSHES PAST YOU TOWARDS THE BLAZE
passages.text:
You follow in his wake until the heat pressing against your face and lungs becomes unbearable. You stagger to a halt, shielding your eyes from the glare.

[[HE STRIDES AHEAD, UNBOTHERED IN HIS HEAVY ROBES]]

links.text: HE STRIDES AHEAD, UNBOTHERED IN HIS HEAVY ROBES

destination.name: HE STRIDES AHEAD, UNBOTHERED IN HIS HEAVY ROBES

passages.name: HER HAIR STREAMS AROUND HER
passages.text:
Her eyes go round. She's looking past you, not at you.

[[A COLD HAND APPEARS ON YOUR SHOULDER]]

links.text: A COLD HAND APPEARS ON YOUR SHOULDER

destination.name: A COLD HAND APPEARS ON YOUR SHOULDER

passages.name: HE STRIDES AHEAD, UNBOTHERED IN HIS HEAVY ROBES
passages.text:
Tabitha screams something at him as he approaches. Her face is shining with tears or sweat.

[[HE GRABS HER BEFORE SHE HAS A CHANCE TO FLEE INTO THE NIGHT OR INTO THE FIRE]]

links.text: HE GRABS HER BEFORE SHE HAS A CHANCE TO FLEE INTO THE NIGHT OR INTO THE FIRE

destination.name: HE GRABS HER BEFORE SHE HAS A CHANCE TO FLEE INTO THE NIGHT OR INTO THE FIRE

passages.name: HE GRABS HER BEFORE SHE HAS A CHANCE TO FLEE INTO THE NIGHT OR INTO THE FIRE
passages.text:
{{{Stop this attention-seeking nonsense and come home, Tabitha. You're only embarrassing yourself.}}}

[[SHE SWIPES AT HIS FACE WITH HER LITTLE FISTS]]

links.text: SHE SWIPES AT HIS FACE WITH HER LITTLE FISTS

destination.name: SHE SWIPES AT HIS FACE WITH HER LITTLE FISTS

passages.name: SHE SWIPES AT HIS FACE WITH HER LITTLE FISTS
passages.text:
{{{What are you trying to prove, girl? I know it suits you to blame me for everything, but it's not my fault you're cold. Come home and let us take care of you.}}}

[[HER HOWL RINGS CLEAR ABOVE THE NOISE OF THE WOODSHED COLLAPSING]]

links.text: HER HOWL RINGS CLEAR ABOVE THE NOISE OF THE WOODSHED COLLAPSING

destination.name: HER HOWL RINGS CLEAR ABOVE THE NOISE OF THE WOODSHED COLLAPSING

passages.name: HER HOWL RINGS CLEAR ABOVE THE NOISE OF THE WOODSHED COLLAPSING
passages.text:
"Take care of me! You never did anything for me! I took care of //you// for years, you pig! I wish I'd killed you when I had the chance!"

[[HE LIFTS HER CLEAR OFF THE GROUND UNTIL THEY'RE NOSE TO NOSE]]

links.text: HE LIFTS HER CLEAR OFF THE GROUND UNTIL THEY'RE NOSE TO NOSE

destination.name: HE LIFTS HER CLEAR OFF THE GROUND UNTIL THEY'RE NOSE TO NOSE

passages.name: HE LIFTS HER CLEAR OFF THE GROUND UNTIL THEY'RE NOSE TO NOSE
passages.text:
{{{I'm offering you a second chance,}}} he snarls, ignoring her flailing feet and fists. {{{Of all the selfish, entitled, ungrateful little –}}}

[[HE FINISHES IN A YELP]]

passages.name: HE FINISHES IN A YELP
passages.text:
Tabitha pulls her teeth out of his wrist, trailing – is it blood?

[[WHATEVER IT IS, IT GLITTERS IN THE FLICKERING LIGHT]]

links.text: WHATEVER IT IS, IT GLITTERS IN THE FLICKERING LIGHT

destination.name: WHATEVER IT IS, IT GLITTERS IN THE FLICKERING LIGHT

passages.name: THIS TIME SHE'S TOO QUICK FOR HIM
passages.text:
She runs blind out of the light of the fire, into the darkness – straight into your arms.

[[YOU FALL TOGETHER IN A TANGLE OF LIMBS AND HAIR]]

links.text: YOU FALL TOGETHER IN A TANGLE OF LIMBS AND HAIR

destination.name: YOU FALL TOGETHER IN A TANGLE OF LIMBS AND HAIR

passages.name: YOU FALL TOGETHER IN A TANGLE OF LIMBS AND HAIR
passages.text: On your back, you see another fountain of sparks erupt into the sky as the woodshed sags further in on itself. [[YOU HEAR THE COMMAND AS IF HE WERE RIGHT BESIDE YOU:]]

links.text: YOU HEAR THE COMMAND AS IF HE WERE RIGHT BESIDE YOU:

destination.name: YOU HEAR THE COMMAND AS IF HE WERE RIGHT BESIDE YOU:

passages.name: HOLD HER
passages.text:
She thrashes as your arms close around her middle. Her furious eyes are red and streaming, her hair singed.

[[WHITISH FLUID, MARBLED WITH BLUE AND GREEN, DRIPS OFF HER CHIN]]

links.text: WHITISH FLUID, MARBLED WITH BLUE AND GREEN, DRIPS OFF HER CHIN

destination.name: WHITISH FLUID, MARBLED WITH BLUE AND GREEN, DRIPS OFF HER CHIN

passages.name: LET HER GO
passages.text:
You get one last look at Tabitha as she scrambles to her feet. Her furious eyes are red and streaming, her hair singed.

[[WHITISH FLUID, MARBLED WITH BLUE AND GREEN, DRIPS OFF HER CHIN|blood]]

links.text: WHITISH FLUID, MARBLED WITH BLUE AND GREEN, DRIPS OFF HER CHIN

passages.name: fadeout
passages.text: <<audio "PrettyDungeon" fadeoverto 2 0>><<timed 2.5s>><<goto "DAY 2a">><</timed>>

passages.name: SLEEP
passages.text: <<audio "MusicBox" fadeoverto 2 0>><<timed 2.5s>><<goto "SLEEP1">><</timed>>

passages.name: week2
passages.text: <<audio "CreepyMusicBox" fadeoverto 2 0>><<timed 2.5s>><<goto "week2title">><</timed>>

passages.name: ch5
passages.text: <<audio "LonelyHouse" fadeoverto 2 0>><<timed 2.5s>><<goto "ch5title">><</timed>>

passages.name: hair
passages.text:
Her eyes go round and she backs away, further into the fire. The heat presses unbearably against your face and lungs, forcing you back.

[[THE BOGEYMAN STALKS AHEAD, UNBOTHERED IN HIS HEAVY ROBES|HE STRIDES AHEAD, UNBOTHERED IN HIS HEAVY ROBES]]

links.text: THE BOGEYMAN STALKS AHEAD, UNBOTHERED IN HIS HEAVY ROBES

destination.name: HE STRIDES AHEAD, UNBOTHERED IN HIS HEAVY ROBES

passages.name: WHATEVER IT IS, IT GLITTERS IN THE FLICKERING LIGHT
passages.text:
{{{You're going to pay for that.}}}

[[HE THRUSTS HER TOWARDS THE FIRE –]]

links.text: HE THRUSTS HER TOWARDS THE FIRE –

destination.name: HE THRUSTS HER TOWARDS THE FIRE –

passages.name: HE THRUSTS HER TOWARDS THE FIRE –
passages.text:
She reaches back, wrenches a smouldering branch from the wreckage.

[[SMASHES IT INTO HIS FACE]]

passages.name: SMASHES IT INTO HIS FACE
passages.text:
It's not a human scream. More like the screech of a bird. Tabitha drops to the ground.

[[THIS TIME SHE'S TOO QUICK FOR HIM]]

links.text: THIS TIME SHE'S TOO QUICK FOR HIM

destination.name: THIS TIME SHE'S TOO QUICK FOR HIM

passages.name: blood
passages.text:
The same instant, she's gone into the night.

[[SECONDS LATER, A SHADOW FALLS BETWEEN YOU AND THE FIRELIGHT]]

links.text: SECONDS LATER, A SHADOW FALLS BETWEEN YOU AND THE FIRELIGHT

destination.name: SECONDS LATER, A SHADOW FALLS BETWEEN YOU AND THE FIRELIGHT

passages.name: WHITISH FLUID, MARBLED WITH BLUE AND GREEN, DRIPS OFF HER CHIN
passages.text:
You only have to hold her for a few seconds before a shadow falls over you both, blotting out the firelight.

[[HE LIFTS HER OFF YOU BY THE SCRUFF OF HER NECK]]

links.text: HE LIFTS HER OFF YOU BY THE SCRUFF OF HER NECK

destination.name: HE LIFTS HER OFF YOU BY THE SCRUFF OF HER NECK

passages.name: YOU HEAR THE COMMAND AS IF HE WERE RIGHT BESIDE YOU:
passages.text:
{{{Hold her.}}}
[[HOLD HER]] [[LET HER GO]]

passages.name: HE LIFTS HER OFF YOU BY THE SCRUFF OF HER NECK
passages.text:
He nods down at you.<<if $breakout eq false and $snitch eq true>>{{{ Good kid. I knew I could count on you.}}}<<else>>{{{ Good kid. I knew you'd prove me right in the end.}}}<<endif>>

[[BETWEEN THE SHADOWS AND ASH, IT'S HARD TO TELL WHETHER HIS FACE IS BADLY BURNED]]

links.text: BETWEEN THE SHADOWS AND ASH, IT'S HARD TO TELL WHETHER HIS FACE IS BADLY BURNED

destination.name: BETWEEN THE SHADOWS AND ASH, IT'S HARD TO TELL WHETHER HIS FACE IS BADLY BURNED

passages.name: BETWEEN THE SHADOWS AND ASH, IT'S HARD TO TELL WHETHER HIS FACE IS BADLY BURNED
passages.text:
Tabitha is writhing and cursing. There's nothing here for her to grab or bite.

[[THE BOGEYMAN SHAKES HER LIKE A CAT WITH A BIRD IN ITS JAWS]]

links.text: THE BOGEYMAN SHAKES HER LIKE A CAT WITH A BIRD IN ITS JAWS

destination.name: THE BOGEYMAN SHAKES HER LIKE A CAT WITH A BIRD IN ITS JAWS

passages.name: SECONDS LATER, A SHADOW FALLS BETWEEN YOU AND THE FIRELIGHT
passages.text:
{{{You,}}} he hisses, like it's the filthiest insult he knows.

[[HE HAULS YOU OFF THE GROUND BY THE SCRUFF OF YOUR NECK]]

links.text: HE HAULS YOU OFF THE GROUND BY THE SCRUFF OF YOUR NECK

destination.name: HE HAULS YOU OFF THE GROUND BY THE SCRUFF OF YOUR NECK

passages.name: burn
passages.text:
{{{Well, you can have it your way. Tabitha can freeze to death out here, and you can burn in her place. I hope that finally makes you happy.}}}
[[I'M SORRY, SIR]] [[GO TO HELL]]

passages.name: HE HAULS YOU OFF THE GROUND BY THE SCRUFF OF YOUR NECK
passages.text:
<<if $snitch eq true or $breakout eq false>>{{{I thought you were better, but you're all the same, aren't you? Horrible, ungrateful little monsters.}}}<<else>>{{{You're all the same, aren't you? Horrible, ungrateful little monsters.}}}<<endif>>

[[BETWEEN THE SHADOWS AND ASH, IT'S HARD TO TELL WHETHER HIS FACE IS BADLY BURNED|burn]]

links.text: BETWEEN THE SHADOWS AND ASH, IT'S HARD TO TELL WHETHER HIS FACE IS BADLY BURNED

passages.name: THE BOGEYMAN SHAKES HER LIKE A CAT WITH A BIRD IN ITS JAWS
passages.text:
{{{Stop fussing, girl. We're going home.}}}

[[HE STARTS TOWARDS THE HOVEL, THEN GLANCES BACK AT YOU]]

links.text: HE STARTS TOWARDS THE HOVEL, THEN GLANCES BACK AT YOU

destination.name: HE STARTS TOWARDS THE HOVEL, THEN GLANCES BACK AT YOU

passages.name: HE STARTS TOWARDS THE HOVEL, THEN GLANCES BACK AT YOU
passages.text:
{{{Come along, fish. Are you hungry? I'm so hungry.}}}
[[YES, I'M HUNGRY]] [[NO, I'M NOT HUNGRY]]

passages.name: YES, I'M HUNGRY
passages.text:
He grins.{{{ Let's eat, then.}}}

[[AND HE SWEEPS ONWARDS WITH TABITHA UNDER ONE ARM|next2]]

links.text: AND HE SWEEPS ONWARDS WITH TABITHA UNDER ONE ARM

passages.name: NO, I'M NOT HUNGRY
passages.text:
{{{Fair enough. }}}He grins.{{{ More for me.}}}

[[AND HE SWEEPS ONWARDS WITH TABITHA UNDER ONE ARM|next2]]

links.text: AND HE SWEEPS ONWARDS WITH TABITHA UNDER ONE ARM

passages.name: AND HE SWEEPS ONWARDS WITH TABITHA UNDER ONE ARM
passages.text:
<<timed 0.1s t8n>>If you follow his footsteps for a minute,<</timed>>
<<timed 2.1s t8n>>then pause and look back at the woodshed,<</timed>>
<<timed 4.1s t8n>>you'll see the last of its structure give way and subside,<</timed>>

<<timed 6.1s t8n>>[[RELEASING STREAMS OF EMBERS INTO THE BLACK AIR.|end]]<</timed>>

links.text: RELEASING STREAMS OF EMBERS INTO THE BLACK AIR.

passages.name: end
passages.text: <>B O G E Y M A N<> <>written and produced by elizabeth smyth<> <>for ifcomp 2018<> <>with thanks to maxamillian john<> <>all music licenced by john leonard french<> <>❤ thank you for playing ❤<>

passages.name: I'M SORRY, SIR
passages.text:
{{{Sorry won't cut it this time, dear. }}}He sneers, letting you see every one of the teeth between you and the hole of his throat.

[[HE SHAKES YOU LIKE A CAT WITH A BIRD IN ITS JAWS]]

links.text: HE SHAKES YOU LIKE A CAT WITH A BIRD IN ITS JAWS

destination.name: HE SHAKES YOU LIKE A CAT WITH A BIRD IN ITS JAWS

passages.name: GO TO HELL
passages.text:
{{{If you like. It's getting cold out here anyway.}}} He sneers, letting you see every one of the teeth between you and the hole of his throat.

[[HE SHAKES YOU LIKE A CAT WITH A BIRD IN ITS JAWS]]

links.text: HE SHAKES YOU LIKE A CAT WITH A BIRD IN ITS JAWS

destination.name: HE SHAKES YOU LIKE A CAT WITH A BIRD IN ITS JAWS

passages.name: HE SHAKES YOU LIKE A CAT WITH A BIRD IN ITS JAWS
passages.text:
Then he slings you under one arm and sweeps towards the hovel.

[[IT YAWNS AT YOU LIKE A BECKONING HOLE IN THE HILLSIDE, GROWING WIDER AND DARKER WITH EVERY STEP|hole]]

links.text: IT YAWNS AT YOU LIKE A BECKONING HOLE IN THE HILLSIDE, GROWING WIDER AND DARKER WITH EVERY STEP

passages.name: IT YAWNS AT YOU LIKE A BECKONING HOLE IN THE HILLSIDE, GROWING WIDER AND DARKER WITH EVERY STEP
passages.text:
<<timed 0.1s t8n>>The waiting mouth of the kitchen door,<</timed>>
<<timed 2.1s t8n>>of the oven,<</timed>>
<<timed 4.1s t8n>>of the end,<</timed>>

<<timed 6.1s t8n>>[[AND SOMEWHERE IN THE DISTANCE, A TINY DOLL-FIGURE RUNNING FOR ITS LIFE]]<</timed>>

links.text: AND SOMEWHERE IN THE DISTANCE, A TINY DOLL-FIGURE RUNNING FOR ITS LIFE

destination.name: AND SOMEWHERE IN THE DISTANCE, A TINY DOLL-FIGURE RUNNING FOR ITS LIFE

passages.name: AND SOMEWHERE IN THE DISTANCE, A TINY DOLL-FIGURE RUNNING FOR ITS LIFE
passages.text:
<<timed 0.1s t8n>>If you twist around in his grasp,<</timed>>
<<timed 2.1s t8n>>and crane your neck to look back at the woodshed,<</timed>>
<<timed 4.1s t8n>>you'll see the last of its structure give way and subside,<</timed>>

<<timed 6.1s t8n>>[[RELEASING STREAMS OF EMBERS INTO THE BLACK AIR.|end]]<</timed>>

links.text: RELEASING STREAMS OF EMBERS INTO THE BLACK AIR.

passages.name: HE SHAKES HIS HEAD WHEN HE SEES YOU'RE COMING ROUND
passages.text:
{{{Absolutely pathetic. Making me come out to rescue you on a night like this. I bet you didn't even bring me anything tasty, did you?}}}

<<if $gotrat or $gotbird>>[[SHOW HIM|givefood]]<<else>>[[SHOW HIM|nofood]]<<endif>>

passages.name: THE COPSE
passages.text:
You trudge until you find yourself once more at the edge of the copse, woody fingers tangling in your hair.
[[GO ON]] [[TURN BACK|down from copse]]

passages.name: GO DOWN 5
passages.text:
The wind makes icicles of your ears, your nose, your fingers. The darkness is perfect, pressed around your face like a mask.

[[STUMBLE|stumble down]]

passages.name: stumble down
passages.text:
Your foot snags on a crack between the rocks. You're too numb to feel anything, but you hear something in your toes go //crack.//<<if $gotrat or $gotbird>>

As you throw your hands out to save yourself, the <<if $gotrat>>rat-thing jumps free and scurries away into the night.<<set $gotrat = false>><<else>>chick flutters out of your hands and disappears. Whether it flew back to its nest, or was snatched away by the wind, it's hard to say.<<set $gotbird = false>><<endif>><<endif>>

[[GET UP]]

passages.name: GET UP
passages.text:
You take a moment to get your bearings before struggling to your feet.
[[GO UP|THE COPSE]] [[GO DOWN|go down 6]]

passages.name: go down 6
passages.text:
You limp onwards, half expecting at every step to bump into more trees, but nothing comes except the rain and the dark.
[[GO UP|THE COPSE]] [[GO DOWN|GO UP 4]]

passages.name: SOON THE FIRE IS BLAZING
passages.text:
Tabitha leaves you to tend to it while she skins and prepares the animal from the trap. At the other end of the table, Peter starts taking blue things out of their jar and doing... //something// to them. Maybe peeling them?

[[YOU'VE NEVER SMELLED SO MANY FLAVOURS OF BAD AT ONCE]]

links.text: YOU'VE NEVER SMELLED SO MANY FLAVOURS OF BAD AT ONCE

destination.name: YOU'VE NEVER SMELLED SO MANY FLAVOURS OF BAD AT ONCE

passages.name: SOMEHOW IT LOOKS LIKE IT MIGHT START OOZING ANYTHING AT ANY MOMENT
passages.text:
It's hard to tell how old he is, but it's always hard to tell with grown-ups. When you first glimpsed him this morning, you thought his teeth were rusty needles. On closer inspection, it turns out they're just stained and a little crooked.

[[REMEMBER TO DRINK YOUR OWN BROTH]]

links.text: REMEMBER TO DRINK YOUR OWN BROTH

destination.name: REMEMBER TO DRINK YOUR OWN BROTH

passages.name: NOT HOME
passages.text:
It's dim in here, midwinter morning dim. There are figures moving around in the shadows, but that's all you can discern as you struggle to blink the sleep from your eyes.

[[A MAN'S VOICE RASPS FROM BEHIND AND ABOVE|welcome 1]]

links.text: A MAN'S VOICE RASPS FROM BEHIND AND ABOVE

passages.name: nothome1
passages.text:
It's dim in here, midwinter morning dim. There are figures moving around in the shadows, but that's all you can discern as you struggle to blink the sleep from your eyes.

[[A MAN'S VOICE RASPS FROM BEHIND AND ABOVE|welcome]]

links.text: A MAN'S VOICE RASPS FROM BEHIND AND ABOVE

passages.name: BEHIND YOU, THE MAN SPEAKS AGAIN
passages.text: Don't be shy, little fish. This is your family now. [[ONE OF THE CHILDREN TAKES YOUR HAND|tabby]]

links.text: ONE OF THE CHILDREN TAKES YOUR HAND

passages.name: GLANCE OVER AND SEE HER STARING DOWN AT SOMETHING IN HER HANDS
passages.text:
It's a knitted jumper for a very small child, smaller even than Grace. It looks handmade. Tabitha starts to say something.

[[SHE CUTS HERSELF OFF, PAUSES]]

passages.name: poison
passages.text:
"You name it, I've thought about it. I daydream about it all the time –" she looks so calm "– all the ways he could suffer, if I were brave enough to try."
[[YOU SHOULD DO IT]] [[YOU SHOULDN'T RISK IT]]

passages.name: YOU SHOULD DO IT
passages.text:
"But I'd be trapping us all here forever. Only he knows how to get out of here, to, you know, the real world. He leaves every Sunday night to steal more children, but nobody knows how he gets there."
[[WHATEVER IT TAKES TO GET HOME|OR POISON HIS FOOD]] [[STAYING HERE ISN'T ALL THAT BAD|OR POISON HIS FOOD]]

links.text: WHATEVER IT TAKES TO GET HOME
STAYING HERE ISN'T ALL THAT BAD

passages.name: YOU SHOULDN'T RISK IT
passages.text:
"Don't worry, I won't. I'd be trapping us all here forever. Only he knows how to get out of here, to, you know, the real world. He leaves every Sunday night to steal more children, but nobody knows how he gets there."
[[WHATEVER IT TAKES TO GET HOME|OR POISON HIS FOOD]] [[STAYING HERE ISN'T ALL THAT BAD|OR POISON HIS FOOD]]

links.text: WHATEVER IT TAKES TO GET HOME
STAYING HERE ISN'T ALL THAT BAD

passages.name: AND THERE'S THAT SMELL AGAIN
passages.text:
<>It looks too small to climb through, but if Tabitha did it, so can you.
[[CLIMB OUT]] [[STAY PUT|THROW THE BLANKETS OFF]]

passages.name: next2
passages.text:
You scramble to your feet and follow close on his heels. Whereas pushing towards the fire was painful, walking away from it is like basking with the sun on your back.

[[HE GREETS YOU CHEERFULLY WHEN YOU DRAW LEVEL, IGNORING TABITHA'S STRUGGLES|HE CALLS BACK TO YOU, IGNORING TABITHA'S STRUGGLES]]

links.text: HE GREETS YOU CHEERFULLY WHEN YOU DRAW LEVEL, IGNORING TABITHA'S STRUGGLES

destination.name: HE CALLS BACK TO YOU, IGNORING TABITHA'S STRUGGLES

passages.name: HE CALLS BACK TO YOU, IGNORING TABITHA'S STRUGGLES
passages.text:
{{{You really proved yourself tonight, fish! I don't think I can rightly keep you here much longer, though I'll be sorry to see you go. Children who learn to be good get to go home, that's the rule.}}}

[[AND YOU HAVE LEARNED TO BE GOOD|going home]]

links.text: AND YOU HAVE LEARNED TO BE GOOD

passages.name: AND YOU HAVE LEARNED TO BE GOOD
passages.text:
<<timed 0.1s t8n>>Ash is settling on the hovel like snow, like icing sugar,<</timed>>
<<timed 2.1s t8n>>like something out of a fairy tale.<</timed>>
<<timed 4.1s t8n>>It looks so soft, now that it has nothing more to teach you.<</timed>>

<<timed 6.1s t8n>>[[YOU EARNED YOUR HAPPY ENDING|AND HE SWEEPS ONWARDS WITH TABITHA UNDER ONE ARM]]<</timed>>

destination.name: AND HE SWEEPS ONWARDS WITH TABITHA UNDER ONE ARM

passages.name: hole
passages.text:
{{{Was it so hard to just do as you're told? I don't think that was asking a lot. I would have taken you home, you know. It could have been so easy. But why am I bothering to lecture you? You're not listening to me. You're just another stupid brat.}}}

[[HIS FINGERNAILS ARE ALREADY PUSHING HUNGRILY INTO YOUR FLESH|fingernails]]

links.text: HIS FINGERNAILS ARE ALREADY PUSHING HUNGRILY INTO YOUR FLESH

passages.name: fingernails
passages.text:
{{{You or Tabitha – it makes no difference to me once you're inside that oven. And you can go to the roast knowing full well that it didn't have to be this way.}}}

[[YOU CAN HEAR HIS STOMACH GURGLING AS YOU APPROACH THE HOVEL|IT YAWNS AT YOU LIKE A BECKONING HOLE IN THE HILLSIDE, GROWING WIDER AND DARKER WITH EVERY STEP]]

links.text: YOU CAN HEAR HIS STOMACH GURGLING AS YOU APPROACH THE HOVEL

destination.name: IT YAWNS AT YOU LIKE A BECKONING HOLE IN THE HILLSIDE, GROWING WIDER AND DARKER WITH EVERY STEP

passages.name: going home
passages.text:
{{{Won't it be nice to be home again in your own bed?}}}

[[IT WILL, IT WILL, IT WILL|AND YOU HAVE LEARNED TO BE GOOD]]

links.text: IT WILL, IT WILL, IT WILL

destination.name: AND YOU HAVE LEARNED TO BE GOOD
